Delicious dishes for lunch & brunch-I've enjoyed both with groups of friends. I love their coffee, the lemon cookies, and their sandwiches. 
Polly was an excellent server who was welcoming, knowledgeable about the menu, & perfectly on par with her recommendations! Every time I've flown into Arizona I come here! The market store is equally amazing & great for loading up on more pastries. The gf cookie is heavenly!!!

The ambiance is nice. I believe the place use to be a house and was turned into a restaurant. Their food is alright, I feel you can easily make the foods they serve but worth a try! Their service is alright as well. I give it a 4 because it's kinda pricey for foods you can easily do at home.

I had the breakfast quesadilla. As far as quesadilla's go is was pretty good. I loved that combination, seasonal veggies, sausage, egg, cheese. They could be a little more generous with the protein, and most of the quacamole was turning brown (not exactly appetizing), but overall it was good. The salsa that it came with was the redeemed the old guacamole.

However, the person who served the guacamole could have been a little more sensible and not served brown guac. Instead, it looked like it was mixed in with the nice looking guacamole as if I wouldn't notice.
Excellent strawberry chicken salad. Outside eating area is mist cooled and shady. Attentive wait staff.

This place is a favorite for many.  Excellent food and known for their signature baby cakes.  It is a little lighter fare though so you may need an appetizer and dessert.  Very popular for ladies lunches, birthdays, and showers.  Great atmosphere with a very friendly staff.  I like to bring my wife here because she loves it.  My mom loves it as well.  I would definitely recommend!!

Can't say if the food is good.  Never got an opportunity to eat.  Service was SO UNBELIEVABLY BAD that we finally left after 45 min of waiting for our waiter to come to our table to even acknowledge us again after getting us our water.

My daughter and  friends celebrated her 15th birthday there today. Everyone was amazingly kind and helpful. They brought out a cake, the room was very nice where they sat and the food was delicious. The employee in the Market was friendly and helpful. It was a great day.

(Lyrics - Estelle ft. Kanye West - American Boy)

This a number one champion sound
Yelp Elites, we about to get down
Who's up for brunch in the town right now?
Just touched down in Oldtown
Bet they give me a pound cake
Tell them put the Mimosa in my hand right now
Tell the hostess we need more seats
We just told out all the floor seats

Take me to a Farms, I'd like to go someday
Take me to Scottsdale, I'd love to see the Cafe
I really want to...come brunch it with you
I'll be at Arcadia Farms



Arcadia Farms Cafe is a farm to table concept, but has been around for the past decade as a hot spot to brunch; and who doesn't like brunch!?

I came with some friends on a lovely Sunday afternoon.  The place is cute as hell yo!  It's like walking into Martha Stewarts home!  As we proceeded to the patio I couldn't help but felt a tad bit posh.  G'day ma'dam!

Anyways, as we sat they started off by serving some delectable strawberry scones to start!  I tell ya; probably the best scones I've ever had and they were free making it even better!  I'm sure one way or another I paid for it though haha!  They were soft to the bite with a perfect flakiness that was not overly falling apart.  It was a perfect pairing with my coffee!  For my entree I ordered their Fresh Berry Crepes; wrap with mascarpone cheese and topped with whipped cream, berries, and candied almonds.  You'd think this was pretty sweet, but instead it was very light and fluffy!  The almonds brought the crunch along with the subtle mascarpone bringing in that after sweetness.

Overall, a solid place for a brunch date or a day with the gals.  I fortunately were with 4 lovely ladies and we had a blast at Arcadia Farms;  guys are welcomed too, but only if you're wearing a bow-tie...wink! - Enjoy!
Amazing service and very friendly service! Only had dessert, but they were great...looking forward to coming back!

One of my favorite go to places to bring my out of town company. Arcadia farms is so quaint and unique. I love sitting out back and feel like I'm in a old fashion back yard!  The food is great. I typically order the strawberry chicken salad with poppyseed dressing and OMG IT iS TO DIE FOR!  Then to top it off I indulge in coconut cream cake... You haven't lived till you taste a dessert like that.  I might have been drooling! They have a small market next door to buy more coconut cake.  Make reservations as it gets real busy when the snow birds fly in!

My boyfriend and I stayed at a (terrible) hotel just 2 blocks from Arcadia Farms and found it quite by accident on our second day.  We loved it so much we ate breakfast AND lunch there every day for the remaining 4 days of our trip!  Excellent food; great music; shabby chic ambiance.  If you can sit at a table at which Debbie is serving, you'll be SO happy and get great service, too.  She's terrific.  And I REALLY recommend that you reserve a table if you're coming for lunch - this place is so fabulous that it is crowded.  My personal favorites:  the chocolate toffee muffin at breakfast and/or the leek, mushroom tart  and for lunch, the ham "sandwich" which is exceptionally good.  Or the strawberry chicken salad...or the coconut cake which is worth every calorie...or the iced tea...or the lunch crepes with wild leeks and chicken...pretty much we tried everything on the menu and everything was completely exceptional.  And the back patio is SO peaceful and relaxing.

so if i was grading this place solely on SERVICE it would get a NEGATIVE 10. the service here sucks. or maybe they hate asians? or anyone who isn't a rich white Scottsdale-ian? whatever, but i NEVER get good service here, i always get seated outside, in this hidden corner............. what the. i actually don't know why i keep coming back.

oh, yes i do. it's the chicken crepe. that is some good chicken. it's amazing. so that's how an awesome chicken crepe took a negative 10 to a positive 2 stars.

their baked goods, i do not recommend. mainly because our server recommended the red velvet cake to us, saying it was a best-seller, and how everyone loved it, blah blah blah... and it was THE WORST cake EVERRRRR. it was gross.

and actually... the only good things that i've had here are the chicken crepe and the cobb salad. everything else has been gross. the appetizers, the crab cakes, the soup.....

and back to the crap-ola service: i brought my mom and sister here for some fun "girl time".... and this was on a rainy/dreary day in december... and they would NOT seat us inside. the snot-faced girl at the front (she's always there and ALWAYS snotty, i totally forgot her name - i actually read her name tag JUST because i wanted to yelp her name....... bummer) said they were completely booked inside. which i dunno, it was pretty empty when we got there and still empty when we left. so whatever. so they seated us OUTSIDE. and then had the nerve to say that the heat lamps were probably not working. uh, great. so i had to beg them to TRY and turn on the heat lamps. 

anyways, mom and sis were not impressed. we had a bad time. and now i will never be back. and i'm sure they won't care, because i'm probably not the clientele that they want. whatevs.

This place was a great surprise.  I thought it would be intimidating based on their website, but I felt immediately at home, they were even welcoming to our sleeping baby.  The server was extremely friendly, and altered everything to be completely veg-friendly for us.  The food was great, and the desserts blew us away.  We were very, very happy with our visit.

We went to Arcadia Farms for breakfast during a trip to Scottsdale. Cute place with nice patio seating. Fresh ingredients. We had the egg strata and the fresh berry crapes, both were great. I would give this a higher rating except the service was so bad. Waitress was basically non-existent. We couldn't get the bill without flagging her down, she acted as if she was too busy to answer questions or check in. If you have time to linger, give it a try, otherwise, there are other nearby options.
Came for brunch but missed it.  Luckily, lunch was pretty amazing!  Definitely going back!

wow ! We just had another amazing lunch at Arcadia Farms. The food is always superb, the pastries divine, and the service is friendly and efficient. This oasis of a restaurant is one of the first I visited in this town, and one of the best, still, 10 years later. the menu is always changing and diverse, and has wonderful vegetarian items as well. The owner is always adding fabulous gift items in the market, so if you don't know it, they have great gifts for the foodie in your life too. Any budding chef would appreciate these thoughtful items, and I am guilty of many a random purchase for my wife who is the chef in our family. Arcadia is a beautifully appointed , farm to table privately owned, jewel ! We are lucky to be able to visit  often.
David K

If you're throwing a bridal shower or baby shower BEWARE. You are told one thing then given a contract that states your event would be cancelled the DAY OF if you have more than the agreed upon amount of people. This will never be mentioned in your emails or conversations, just a note that you will be "uncomfortable" if there are more people. As a host, how can you control people who choose to show up but don't rsvp? No one in their right mind would agree to risk their event being cancelled the day of. You will deal with two different people who give you different information but then don't make up for their mistakes but just "promise you a good time". Then you will attempt to call them many times over the course of planning your event, only to never receive phone calls back. Arcadia farms obviously hosts many showers and you will be treated as such-- A dime a dozen. They don't care about the customer, just about how much money they make. My advice is to find another venue. There are many, many more options in Scottsdale that are willing to help not just take your money.

I had the most beautiful bridal shower at Arcadia Farms in their Hacienda room! The ONLY somewhat negatives are that the room is across from the actual restaurant and parking can be a bit of a challenge. The room, service and food were absolutely amazing for my tea party themed shower. Service was attentive, food was delicious (especially the desserts) and the space was nice and cool on a warm day. I would totally recommend having a private party here and going across the street and eating at the actual restaurant. Perfect!

I love this place!  Visited recently and had the Pesto Grilled Shrimp Salad - YUMM-O!  I've had several things off their menu over the years and everything is always fresh and flavorful.   If you go, you must save room for dessert!  Two words - Baby Cakes!!   If you can't eat dessert on your visit, buy some baked items to take home!  The granola is outstanding too!!

Atmosphere is charming - like visiting an old friends' home.  I can't wait for the weather to cool off because eating on their side patio area is adorable!  You really won't believe you are sitting in the heart of Scottsdale - like being in a villa in Tuscany!!  

There is a reason this place has been a Valley destination for "ladies who lunch" and just about anyone who has ever had or attended a shower (bridal or baby) has probably celebrated at least once at AF!  It seems like every weekend there is someone having a party here!  

Heard the waitress talking to another table that you can reserve use of the entire place for evening events!  Would be a sweet set up for a party - to have the entire place to yourself....like entertaining at home without all the clean up!  Nice!!
Decent food, little over priced and service is average! But overall great environment and tasty.
The ambiance and service is amazing. We sat outside and really enjoyed the experience. The food was better than average but not the best I've had. We had an omelette and the smoked salmon plate.

Everyone has a favorite lunch spot or two that they frequent regularly... well, maybe not everyone, but I do!  Arcadia Farms - Scottsdale happens to be one of mine.  Since I'd never been to the Arcadia Farms location at the Phoenix Art Museum, I thought I'd change it up a bit and suggested this location for a business lunch the other day...

I arrived early and the place was pretty empty, so it was no problem to get a table and do some work while I waited.  The waitress was friendly (not super friendly but just fine) and brought me a mango iced tea- my favorite - just like the Arcadia Farms Scottsdale!  I perused the menu and noticed some similarities on the menu, but a few different options too.  My usual favorite salad (grilled vegetable with chicken) was not on the menu but there were a few items that were different and sounded good.  I was up in the air between the california roll salad and the greek... I opted for the greek and added shrimp.  

Side note - usually, at the other location, they bring fresh bread... we did not receive bread nor were we offered bread at this location.  

Anyways, our food arrived pretty quickly - and my salad was good... not great, but good.  It was served with a small portion of hummus and a couple pita triangles, but I wasn't too impressed with the flavor of the hummus.  The salad had a few too many onions in it (but i guess that's my fault; I could've ordered it without onions).

All in all, I had a lovely lunch as I was in great company and my food was fine.  I would go back but maybe order something different next visit.  And if I had the choice, I'd go to one of the other locations (maybe City Bakery or the Heard Museum) over this one.  But I will say, that if you're at the Phoenix Art Museum and in the mood for a light lunch or snack, this place is perfect.

It's no secret that I'm a huge fan of Arcadia Farms, and when I heard they were going to be opening a marketplace across the street, I was psyched.  Of course, this was many months ago... So when I woke up this morning to see an email in my inbox (thanks Lisa G) saying that they were now open for business, I was very excited and knew immediately where to go for lunch.  

Needless to say, I made it a priority to get there asap (I didn't want to miss the opportunity to get the FTR).  While it's different than I expected, I was pleasantly surprised!  

The menu is diverse and includes many of the AF signature items such as the Mushroom, Spinach & Goat Cheese Tart, the Strawberry Chicken Salad, and their extraordinary desserts.  In addition, they offer plenty of new options such as a Chopped Italian Salad, a Tuna Nicoise Salad, and a Roasted Artichoke & Ricotta Cheese sandwich.  There is a daily soup, and plenty of breakfast items (think everything from muesli to quiche, muffins, croissants, and granola parfaits).  Arcadia Farms' famous apricot iced tea is also on the menu, as well as a full coffee menu. 

I went with the  AF Breakfast Sandwich ($6.95).  It's an MJ English muffin, scrambled eggs, aged cheddar cheese, and your choice of ham or bacon.  They made it with egg whites for me, and it was delicious.  My dining companions had a sandwich and soup, respectively.  Everything is made to-go, but there is plenty of seating outside if you choose to dine there like we did today.  

Marketplace offers a simpler fast/casual option for breakfast, lunch, or a comforting snack in Old Town... They use natural, organic, and local products, and it shows.  Everything is fresh and delicious.  I anticipate this being a welcome addition to my "rotation" of go-to spots in my 'hood.
Love the crepes, eggs, potatoes and bacon. All the starters are fabulous. Mimosas were on the ok level. You can't do a better brunch spot on a fall Saturday.

Two words: coconut cake. Literally the main reason I keep going back to this place. Most recently I had the "breakfast panini" which was dry and not pressed as a panini should be. They used to have the MOST AMAZING salmon salad but don't get excited because they took it off the menu. Avoid sitting on the out skirts of the patio as you will be drenched with dripping from the misters. Mimosa was not worth $9- like it's 2018 have a $5 mimosa for me for brunch, I just hiked Camelback. They had ran out of the fresh squeezed OJ so I enjoyed two very average mimosas. Why get two if you are complaining about the price you ask.... YOU DON'T KNOW MY LIFE. Even with the negatives I'll be back because this place is cute, maybe one day the salmon salad will return and coconut cake. Also planning my unconvinced babies shower here. Stay tuned.

My go to place to not only meet friends, but always take our visitors here. It is one of the most consistently fabulous meals, not only for lunch but brunch as well.  The best humus ever, and every salad is delicious. I suggest always make a  reservation, especially if you want to sit outside. Parking is a nightmare if valet is full. Service is exceptional as always!!!

Lovely spot, comfy seating on cushioned benches outside and big couches and chairs inside. Our very sweet server, Polly, made great recommendations and an awesome white sangria! Food was fantastic and generous portions. Get the warm Brie with caramelized apples for the table!

Amazing restaurant. Seriously couldn't ask for anything better. The service was wonderful and helpful and the food was fantastic - fresh, healthy, local. We ordered the crab & avocado tower to start. Phenomenal. For my entree, I ordered the Roasted Salmon Super Salad (photo). The portion was great with plenty of greens and fish. Another member of our party ordered the garden vegetable & chicken quesadilla (photo) - she thought it was excellent. Other items ordered: the trio of bruschetta, the farmer's market fresh fruit crisp, coffee, and freshly brewed peach unsweetened iced tea. Prices were right for the portions and freshness and everything was outstanding! The restaurant itself is what pushes this place from 4 to 5 stars: it's cute with a very nice ambiance and decor. There's street parking and valet parking.

I am here for a party.  The place we reserved was not available so we got a private room-which is nice.  Our waiter is working across the street and here.  He is nice but very scatter brained (because he was running between the restaurant and the party room).  I would not recommend this place for a party - but the good was very good.
The reservations for our party were made weeks ahead of time - so the management was aware of us being there.  Management did not staff the place accordingly - (yea on the restaurant / food - - boo on the management)

The food is good, but service struggles during breakfast at this pretty little place in Scottsdale. I've been a few times in the last month with work colleagues. Plenty of parking on the street out front during weekday morning. The place has always been mostly empty one my visits but the one server seemed really frazzled. I was finished with my first cup of coffee before my friends decaf arrived. And my colleagues were half done with their omelette and and tarts by the time my bowl of muesli was delivered. We had to flag (literally waving arms) done the waitress to refill our water and coffee.

Though service is scattered, the food is really good. The complimentary strawberry scones dusted with powdered sugar are tasty and the muesli is some of the best I've had ever- creamy, loaded with cinnamon, diced fruit, golden raisins, nuts. I wouldn't be my first choice given all the service issues, but if the meeting is scheduled for this place at least the breakfast is tasty.

Terribly understaffed.  We had a 10 minute wait for a hostess to greet and seat us.  After being seated, we waited 22 minutes before walking out.  My first restaurant experience in Scottsdale was very disappointing.

Super cute place but underwhelming food and over priced. $16 for a small to medium sized salad! And the potato salad that came with my bf's sandwich was mediocre at best. And there really is no excuse at a fancy restaurant in old town for a server not to write down an order, and then have to come back after 2 times of saying our food will be up shortly and then a 3rd time having to come back and ask what it was we ordered in the first place!

Dining at Arcadia Farms reminds me fondly of the "L'Idiot" bistro in the movie L.A. Story, where Steve Martin and the cast enjoy an absurd brunch in a satire-like restaurant and order daft items like "a half double decaffeinated half-caf, with a twist of lemon" and "decaffeinated coffee ice cream".    

Its exactly like this at AC.  Slightly cartoon-y, almost a parody of itself, but kind of charming in a way that makes you realize that you sit firmly on the outside of this demographic.  I find this kind of setting immensely charming, as did Steve Martin, and wryly grinned his way through haute fare and caricatures.  

My gf and I smartly decided to pinch our way into Easter Brunch here after failing at Cafe ZuZu (fortunately) and Trader Vic's (thankfully), and ended up having, what can be described as the most exemplary Easter Brunch imaginable; wrought iron bistro table-tops for two, shady oaks, white linen table cloths, brick pathways, french doors, and aproned servers.

Brunch started off with breadrolls and a bottle of Fume Blanc, which was very crisp, but not tart.  A perfect brunch choice.  My gf ordered the raspberry stuffed french toast (which, as selections go, was my first choice, but was nice enough to concede the dish to her) and I chose the Breakfast Bruschetta.  We sipped our wines and waters on a very calm and cool back patio, thankful that we found a perfect spot for such an occasion on the fly.

About 20 minutes later, our meals were delivered and i was immediately satisfied with the presentation.  The bruschetta consisted of egg, sausage, and mozza on french baguette slices.  It was delicious.  The french toast was seasoned perfectly, and the raspberry and strawberries on top were a nice compliment, although, the menu claimed infusion of raspberries, and I could not detect anything resembling that.

The desserts were tempting, but we were satisfied with the wine as a digestif, though we ended up gorging ourselves shortly afterward with mechiladas and Belgian beers at the Vig, anyway, so dessert should have been in order.  

Just something to make up for on our next visit.

Want to join the "ladies who lunch" crowd? Arcadia Farms is the spot to do it. It's an adorable little cottage with outdoor garden seating, and frilly decor, giant goblets of iced tea, huge salads, and irresistible baked goods. 

I had a shrimp salad that was that perfect balance of healthy and filling. Prepare to pay "special occasion" lunch prices ($25-30 pp)... it adds up quickly. Service was beyond friendly!

Rosemary, thank you so very much for making my day out with my mother so enjoyable. Her handicap truly limits our ability to do much these days but you were so accommodating and kind, thank you. This is her favorite restaurant and she enjoyed every bit... Our lunch was Delicious! Thank you again.
Sherry Handzel

Shared a nice outside brunch with a friend on Sunday.  I love the feel of the place (clean and cozy).  The food was very delicious too!  Service was on the slower side.
I ordered the Breakfast Panini:  egg, applewood smoked bacon, cheddar cheese, arugula and roasted tomato.  The sandwich was pressed nice and crispy.  I added breakfast potatoes (some of the bigger chunks were not completely cooked yet).   

I give it overall a 3.5.  I would love to come back to try the other items on the menu.

This place is so cute! It seems like you're in a cafe in a small, quaint town! The farm to table is definitely a plus for this place as well! I got the bean omelet and it was delicious. Our server even brought us some scones on the house and they were scrumptious. Only vice: The birds. For some reason the birds were everywhere here on the back patio. Otherwise, definitely would return to try more of their baked goods and more items on their menu!

It is a very beautiful cafe and the food and staff is great. The reason I didn't give five stars is that their rest room is kinda awkward area of the room and it was a bit hard to find a parking near the cafe. Otherwise it was wonderful experience ! Love to go back!

Arcadia Farm is a Phoenix standby, I moved here over 10 years ago, it was thriving then and it's still thriving. It's a ladies who lunch kind of place full of nutritious, delicious light lunch fares and a wait staff with extremely low turn over. It is not surprising to find a wait staff who has worked there for over ten years. 
I used to go there often with clients when I had my architectural office but it's been years since I was there last. 
When Lindsey organized a CMYE $3 donation (for a delicious baby cake) to St. Mary's Food Bank, I happily signed up. 
There were 15 of us there and we were seated in a private back room with fresh flowers on the table, very nice. 
The waitress was very friendly and bragged about the owner which is always a good sign when the staff is happy. My friend and I ordered the crab cake and grilled shrimp salad to share and although it took awhile for the food to arrive, it was delicious. 
They also surprised us with complimentary hummus, pasta with grilled shrimp, and a desert tray. So really, we didn't have to order any food and we would have been plenty full!
The generosity of the owner who I hope one day to have the pleasure to meet as she seems like the kind of wonderful lady I would enjoy sharing a conversation with, is apparent. And this stands to reason why after so many years when many restaurants have opened and closed, Arcadia Farm is still as successful and popular as ever. 
I and Yelp thank you for a generous and enjoyable afternoon of lunching!

Charming outdoor garden seating area and friendly staff. The chicken quesadilla was simple and satisfying. We enjoyed the accompanying guac and spicy green salsa. I had the grilled vegetable salad with chicken, which was fresh, but the vegetables seemed to be sauteed, not grilled and the lime vinaigrette was bland. I'd recommend Arcadia for a relaxing lunch in the sun, but it's not a spot for a fine culinary experience.

Yet another amazing meal.  I come here every single time I am in town.  The decor is to die for and makes you feel warm and cozy.  

I always get the pesto shrimp salad.  I actually go home (back to Hawaii) wishing I could eat it all the time.  The shrimp are fresh, tasty greens, awesome dressing and lots of fresh corn and avocado.  Thanks Arcadia Farms, you will see me again!

Overall, I really enjoy this cafe. It's quaint, the food is good, and they have a cute, shady patio for you to take advantage of. Sometimes the servers are hard to pin down, but on my last visit, Pam was amazing. When my sister mentioned that we were celebrating our mother's birthday, Pam brought out an adorable mini cake with a candle. (We really appreciated that!)

I was a little disappointed with my Fresh Berry Crepes. For the price they charged ($13) I didn't expect to have canned? frozen? blueberries on them. (They did include fresh strawberries though.) However, I wanted to keep five stars on my review because I think their Strawberry Chicken Salad and Herb Roasted Chicken are delicious. 

If you're meeting friends for lunch, this is a great choice. They also seem to celebrate a lot of baby and bridal showers. Overall- it's a solid choice for breakfast or lunch.

Extremely over rated restaurant the food is very bland. You can open any bag of lettuce and dress it poorly to get the same result. The service was terrible. The waitresses are rude and once they take your order you will never see them again 

When I asked what was recommended the waitress was completely put out. When i asked for a four top in the main dining room the miserable idiot they hired for a hostess could not have been less gracious., she wanted to put us in the back shitty add on when the main dining room was 1/2 full  Their style is pure 70's shabby chic gone stale. The food cannot amaze anyone unless you have been living on hospital food. Do not waste your time and money. This place has jumped the shark.

Coming in from out of time I found out that a reservation was needed for the main restaurant so ended up wandering into the cage next door. Much quieter than the main restaurant and lovely for a quick bite of breakfast. Excellent latte and quiche. Service was very friendly and welcoming. A little slow but didn't mind and gave me time to look at all the amazing cookbooks and specialty items.

I intended to come here for brunch, but I think I was a little late.  They gave me a lunch menu.  The complimentary was really good.  It was warm, buttery, and grilled.  I ordered the raspberries salad with Fossil Creek goat cheese.  I added some chicken for protein.  I also shared the BLT.  The sandwich was good.  The potato salad that came with the sandwich was yummy.  I couldn't resist ordering dessert so I ordered the key lime pie.  It was delicious!  It wasn't too sweet and the crust had toasted coconut flakes.  Overall, the food was fresh and of high quality.

Most of the patrons were woman.  I don't blame them.  I would be here on a Saturday morning shooting the breeze with my friends if I lived closer.  Arcadia Farms is really cute.  They have indoor and outdoor seating.  I wanted to sit outside under the covered patio, but it was all full.  I would like a similar place in CA.

No Pop! Champagne, but we did put down a bottle of a very tasty Zinfandel from Lodi, CA. 

Cheese plate... Yum.

I had the goat cheese salad. It was superb.

She had some kind of crepe. It was very yummy.

I didn't go inside once. I have too much testosterone. We sat out on the patio and it was very nice, even in the heat, due to the misters. That's kind of funny. The matrons of Scottsdale sit inside, away from the misters. 

Everything was fresh, tasty, well prepared, artfully plated, and the service was very good. Hard to go wrong! It's a great place for exquisite food and stimulating conversation, lubricated by a bottle of wine.

We liked it so much we ended up coming back for breakfast the next day too! Such a quaint, adorable farm-vibe restaurant in the middle of downtown Scottsdale. The food tasted exquisite and fresh. Our meal started off great because they brought out fresh, complimentary scones that just melted in your mouth - perfection. My mom and I split the breakfast sandwich and the french toast, it was definitely too much food but I couldn't decide and wanted to try both sweet and savory! I'm glad I did, both were excellent. The ciabatta was so fresh and the french toast's custard was scrumptious. Their marketplace was also super cute! We got a chocolate croissant to go and it held up until hours later (when I could actually eat again). Next time I want to try one of their salads!

I have been wanting to go here for a while  and I finally made it . We went for breakfast on a nice sunny day and sat outside under the umbrellas. Our server was very pleasant. I ordered  the black bean ,avocado , goat cheese , omelette and my husband ordered the wild mushroom chives goat cheese omelette. Both were good . I would try something different next time & give this  place another try . The outside seating is the best thing about this restaurant.

Arcadia farms is an exquisite lunch or brunch spot. It's as cozy and elegant as can be. Perfect for a lunch out with the girls! Our group enjoyed the crab appetizers with gazpacho. I ordered the shrimp pesto salad with tortilla frizzles. Yum! I feared it would be super garlicky, but this dish was delicious and well balance. Pair that with their famous iced tea and you're all set! Their baked goods looked delicious too.

Tried this place for the first time two weeks ago and loved it.  Fresh food, neat ambiance, very well done overall.  Not the cheapest option for lunch, but healthy and fresh.  I tried their BLT with avocado and it was outstanding.  Once the weather cools down a bit I am going to head back here and try their patio - looked charming as well.

Love this adorable spot.  The marketplace is fantastic as an early morning for coffee and AMAZING pastry after a crisp morning walk.

The cafe for brunch or lunch is so quaint, it was just lovely!  Atmosphere is just completely adorable.

Food amazing.  I had the mushroom, spinach and goat cheese tart. Absolutely perfect. My group also recommends quesadilla omelette and the crapes with ham and cheese with béchamel sauce.

Service was friendly, quick and professional.

The food quality is suspect. Disappointed they do not have coconut or almond milk, or stevie or another sugar/artificial sweetener healthy alternative. In my experience, when a restaurant doesn't have these simple healthy choices, they probably don't care about all of the ingredients in their food. Place is a nice atmosphere but for those who are meticulous about food choices and their health, buyer beware.

I have been a loyal customer practically since day one. Have always loved everything about Arcadia Farms but have noticed a slow decline over the past few years. Not as much attention to detail in the presentation. No more hot bread and butter served while waiting for your meal. Smaller portions. Food, always the consistent constant, not so much. 

Recently I took my 85-year old mother for lunch to commemorate what would have been my parents' 60th anniversary, as Arcadia Farms had been my mom's favorite restaurant for many years. We waited and waited. Once we ordered an appetizer, it came sailing out, followed literally a couple of minutes later by our entrees (my mom's crepes were burned and hard, and when I was sticking my fork into the bowl of shrimp salad, surprise, no bowl. It has been shrunk to the point that it is now served on a plate).  The waitress looked at us and said, oh, you're not ready, then plopped our meals on the table and fled. We did not see her again for half an hour after we had finished. We planned on dessert; Mom loves the coconut baby cake, but no server. We opted for ice cream on the way home. It will be a very long time before we return, if ever. Too many quality restaurants more deserving of our investment of time and especially of money. 

Sad to see the decline in what had been a favorite and favored restaurant.

A classic, gourmet breakfast/ lunch café that offers fresh, healthy dishes. Nice outside patio seating, leisurely services, and great coffee.

The café has the most "beautiful" crepe croquet-monsieur. The crepe was decorated with parsley, tomatoes, and creamy sauce. It looks like a blossoming flower from afar. And it tastes as good as it looks. Breakfast Quesadilla is stuffed with roasted zucchini, bell pepper, and corn. It is fresh but not super flavorful. I am not sure corn mixes well with zucchini and bell pepper.

Note: Reservations are essential for weekends. Also, may not be the first choice for carnivores and families with young kids.

This place was phenomenal, we came here for brunch right when we landed and it was such a cute place! Julie was extremely welcoming and gave us free strawberry scones once we told her we were here for a bachelorette party. The scones just melted in our mouths and we were done with them in a few short minutes! We can't wait to come back next time we are in Scottsdale! We'll definitely be telling all of our friends and family to stop by Arcadia Farms when they are in town! Thanks Julie for your hospitality!!

What a cute quiet little cafe. The patio is the perfect place to be on a warm day. I picked this place because of the brunch reviews on yelp and they did not disappoint. 

Before we even ordered they brought us bite sized scones that were to die for. They almost tasted like a biscuit but more flakey like a scone. Their mimosa menu has so many good juice selections. I had mango and it was delicious. My friends got strawberry and it was very refreshing. For food I had the Mushroom goat cheese omelet and my friend got the breakfast quesadilla. Both were delicious. The egg to mushroom and goat cheese ratio was perfect. The side of breakfast potatoes made it the quintessential breakfast plate. The breakfast quesadilla was packed with veggies and cheese. It came with a green and red salsa to add even more flavor. So yummy!

Oh, love this place! Food and atmosphere are both fabulous! The only thing was, it was warm inside, wish they would have turned the air down a little. The dessert is incredible. You have to get the tuxedo cake!!

We rented out the restaurant  for our rehearsal  dinner the night prior to  our wedding and it was unbelievable. Arcadia Farms cafe is not open for dinner but can be booked for  special  occasions. We had 40 guests for dinner. Food was amazing , service  was too, and the setting incredible ! If you are looking for elegance  and romantic  in a private setting for a special  occasion I highly recommend Arcadia  Farms Cafe ! All of our family and friends were so impressed as well as my wife and I .

My husband and I came here on a Sunday morning & decided to give it a try after we saw the reviews. The atmosphere is very "Sunday brunch" themed, so perfect for getting brunch/lunch and mimosas with the girls, or just going out for something nice on a weekend morning. We started off with the unsweetened peach tea, along with the Brie and strawberries & bread appetizer. He had the crab cakes, while I had the hot chicken sandwich with potato salad. The food here was AMAZING. Everything we had was full of flavor, the presentation was good, you can taste the freshness with every bite you had. It was exactly what we were looking for as far as wanting something light and healthy. For dessert, we had the chocolate raspberry baby cake, which was to die for! Overall, VERY good experience at this place, we will definitely be coming back here when we're back in town!

This is one of my favorite lunch spots in town! The food is fantastic and the service is great. The staff is extremely friendly and the decor is adorable and very inviting. I would suggest making a reservation if you can as they get pretty busy. The mushroom crepe and shrimp pesto salad are two of my favorite dishes. In addition, make sure you save room for dessert! The mini cakes are completely worth it.

It's 7:10 AM in the morning and they still haven't opened their doors. When the girl finally got off the phone and opened the door for business I asked her where the cookies were and she said that the main restaurant had special orders and they were not able to prepare them. When asked when will they be ready the girl replied "in about two hours alright?"

Actually no it's not alright and her attitude didn't help matters. Lame.

Mmmm... best Birthday Brunch ever!

Arcadia Farms is adorable.  Sitting on the front patio for Sunday Brunch I felt like I should be wearing some sort of hat and perhaps a floral dress.  No need - mimosas can be just as easily consumed in jeans!

Our server was fantastic - once determining that all four of us were having mimosas, she recommended getting a bottle of champagne & carafe of OJ as opposed to separate drinks - less expensive and more bubbly!  So, right off the bat I knew I liked her.  My esteem only grew when halfway through our meal the hostess accidentally removed our champagne bucket from the nearby empty table where we were keeping it.  Our server (gosh I wish I could remember her name!) chased it down and brought it back like a hero!  

OK, on to the food.  Shortly after we ordered, our rockstar server brought us a plate of complimentary strawberry scones, since she thought our food might be delayed since a party of 14 had just ordered.  Delicious!  It did not seem to me like our meals took a long time to arrive, either.  My friends enjoyed their entrees (French toast, black bean omlette and egg strada cobbler).  I loved mine too - I had the Crepes "Croque-Monsieur" (no, I can't pronounce that).  Crepes filled with ham & gruyere cheese and topped with bechamel sauce.  I prefer savory vs. sweet and these were spot on.

We finished our "ladies who brunch" experience with dessert - cute little cakes filled with rasberry and chocolate mousse.  

After all of that wonderful food, the rest of the day was kind of a blur...

Love, love, love Arcadia Farms and can't wait to go back.  This will be my new "go to" spot for out of town guests!
This place is heavenly heaven..... just perfect not too much not tooo little. If u hate veggies, you should come and eat them here. They cooked fantastically...
Fantastic food and ambiance. Very attentive wait staff. Excellent choice for great Scottsdale experience.

I just called and asked if all or some items on the menu is Organic (someone did a review saying it all is organic, but being that it's an allergy issue for me I thought I'd call) The fact that the worker had to put me on hold twice to ask (a second time once she understood the difference between organic and GF, vegan, etc) that alone should have told me the answer is no. If a restaurant is all about being organic, I would think the whole staff would be knowledgeable of that fact. 
But no, the only organic items are the greens on the menu- FYI for all ya'll

My favorite lunch spot in scottsdale! The atmosphere is wonderful, as is the food & service. I have never tried anything I didn't like. And their babycake desserts are fabulous! My personal favorite is the chocolate rasberry.

My original review was written just over a year ago, so when I was invited to a baby shower here today I was hoping I would have a better experience. 

I'll start by saying I added one star because it really is just a lovely place, it's too bad the food is so average, and that's being generous. 

I got an iced tea............So over brewed and way too strong, almost bitter. 

I ordered the Pesto Grilled Shrimp Salad (see pics) marinated and grilled shrimp, baby lettuces, diced avocado, baby tomatoes, goat cheese, grilled corn and lime vinaigrette topped with frizzled tortillas, sounds delicious no? 

No is right! Seriously the vinaigrette was all oil, no lime or acidity at all, there wasn't enough of anything on the salad to get a good bite of all the flavors bland as they were, and the fried tortilla strips were old and very greasy, really a $14 salad should be nothing less than divine. 

My daughter got the Albacore Tuna Salad Sandwich (see pics) $12 
albacore tuna, pecans, jicama, scallions, cucumbers and purple cabbage on sunflower , whole wheat bread with potato salad. 

Again sounds Delicious but was less than stellar. 

The Tuna mixture had a decent flavor but the tuna wasn't even mixed thoroughly, it was in large chunks straight from the can. 

The potato salads potatoes were barley done, almost crunchy and lacking any flavor that would make me want to continue eating nearly raw potatoes. 

The atmosphere isn't enough to intoxicate my senses into believing I'm eating something amazing. How unfortunate that so many can be blinded by a "trend" because the food is just not all that.
Food was decent but nothing to write home about. Service was pretty slow. I would go back only for the croissants.

A cute and cozy breakfast cafe in the Arts District of Scottsdale serving breakfast and lunch.

I really wanted to like this place -it's really cute and on a nice day it would be a great place to sit and chat and enjoy the many shaded outdoor spots.

Maybe it was the rainy morning but our experience was a bit underwhelming. We arrived at 8, just as they opened and were greeted and given our choice of tables as we were the days first customers.

TIP: essential to have a reservation here (which we did) as it got busier and busier and they turned lots of walk-ins away.

Saying service is leisurely is the most generous way I can describe our experience. Even though we were the first customers, our server didn't drop by for 5-10 minutes with greetings and water. Further, once we ordered, it was over 45 minute wait for the food-breakfast food-French toast and an egg sandwich.  So surprising since typically breakfast fare is the fastest and easiest to prepare.

Maybe they were short of staff or maybe it was just the rain. 4 star food with 2 star service and as I always say, good food is a given; service is what really sets a place apart.

Reluctantly, not recommended.

I ate here today and seven years ago. Here is a recap of both.

Seven years ago my friend had a bridal shower lunch here. We sat in the back of the restaurant. Food was unremarkable, service was decent except I specifically remember the waitress disappeared for long periods of time. The atmosphere was beautiful.

Today, the food was still unremarkable. What do I mean by that? I mean I ordered the salmon sandwich with fruit. It came missing the onion and arugula the menu said it came with. The mayo or aioli that comes "on" it was slopped on the side of the sandwich. (I don't care if it's a $3 sandwich or a $19 sandwich, I like when people take pride in their product and put the condiments where they belong) No fruit, and a side salad instead. I told the waitress right away that I would be OK with the salad, but I would need some dressing. Yes, the salad came completely dry. 

My grandmother asked for an extra side of poppyseed dressing for her salad, and the rest of us were finished with our meal by the time the extra dressing arrived. One time she tried to ask the waitress about it, but she didn't hear I guess because she just kept walking. We sat on the patio, again the atmosphere was beautiful! The patio was not very busy. Seven tables, we were one of three tables, a fourth had been sat by the end of our meal.

After lunch, I went to use the restroom to wash my hands before checking out the Marketplace next door. The bathroom needed serious attention. Empty toilet paper rolls, a GIANT turd floating in the toilet, awful odor, and the sink was very dirty. 

I might associate the stench and unremarkable food with the restaurant from now on. :-( 
I did the right thing, and let the hostess know so that someone could clean up the bathroom. 

Nextdoor is the Marketplace, and I purchased a baby carrotcake to take home to my husband.

We were looking for a good brunch place to meet our aunts while visiting from San Diego.  A friend suggested Arcadia Farms.  What a delightful place to spend time with friends.  The attention by staff was just right, and the food was just perfect.  We each enjoyed the tasty, fresh, well-presented dishes.  For locals and travelers alike, this is a stop worth making.

Always my go to for brunch or lunch with mom. There have been several newer quaint  farm to table type restaurant openings lately in the area but Arcadia Farms is a classic, they never disappoint. The food is delicious every time. The servers always have a smile on. The overall atmosphere is just lovely. If you are in the Old Town Scottsdale area looking for a special brunch or lunch spot this is it!

This place is very cute, quaint, and homely. good place to take the mom out to eat or the inlaws. or your grandma. lots of old ladies. not exactly for a business meeting for the men, or anyone who is socially outcast, really.

i met one of my professors here for lunch and it was perfect..service was good, and i loved my mini bottle of korbel. ice cold water with lemon. she got a salad and i devored the tuna sandwich with potato salad. that potato salad was quite possibly the best potato salad i've ever had. big chunks of potato and not too overwhelming with the dressing. the tuna was fresh and not fishy, the veggies on it were crisp, and the bread was soft and mushy. mmmm.

I had such a great time at Arcadia Farms Cafe with my friends for a bridal luncheon! We walked through the cute little cafe and then into a building off the back patio for a private lunch. Our server was fantastic -- super fun and personable.
Between the 8 of us we ordered peach Bellini's, mimosa, and sangria with red. I couldn't really make out the peach flavor in my Bellini, but I've also never had one before so I'm not air what the standard is. The sangria was good (and quite large). 
We ordered and the food arrived promptly. I got the shrimp pesto salad and honestly wish I could eat it everyday! The shrimp was done perfectly, not at all rubbery and perfectly glazed with the pesto sauce. I should have asked what the dressing was because it complemented the person and goat cheese very well. I enjoyed the fresh corn that was on the salad, could have had a bit more. I'm not a huge tomato fan-but if you are they are plentiful on this salad.
Another dish I remember others getting and loving was the Mediterranean sandwich and the turkey and Brie sandwich (with fig jam and apples). 
We had a lovely time here-it's a great place to chat and enjoy yummy food!
Super cute brunch spot with the girls!! The salmon was cooked to perfection. The cheese plate and the wine list looked incredible, would go back in a heartbeat!!
Love this place. Cozy. Warm. Friendly staff. The food is  great. Do you need more on a Sunday morning after a long hike? Don't think so.
Food was just ok for Saturday breakfast. Service was terrible and waitress a grumpy bi***
Parking was unavailable due to valet blocking spots which is illegal.  Service was extremely slow.    Food has always been good enjoy the salads.

So I got the warm veggie salad ($14) and added shrimp ($5 extra). There were 4 medium-sized shrimp on it. Awful. I tried asking for more and they said no. This place seems very high-class and snobbish. Perhaps it was because I was wearing a T-shirt they sat us in the sun. If you don't mind paying a lot for mediocre food and enjoying a very snobbish atmosphere, this is your place!

We came here to try their brunch, but unfortunately we got there a bit late and ended up having lunch there instead. 

I ordered their crab cake entree, which came with 2 small crab cake lumps and the rest of the plate was a salad. From the menu description and the price they charged, I would have expected more/larger crab cakes. This entree felt more like an appetizer portion but they charged lunch price for it. Despite this, it was actually pretty good, although I wouldn't order it for a lunch entree again. 

We were seated in their outdoors patio area. It would have been nice to enjoy a nice afternoon eating outdoors.  However, their patio was lined with large old trees hovering over most of the outdoor tables. In addition, there were many birds swooping in and out of those trees.  We had to be careful both of falling leaves/debris and bird poop the whole time.

Delicious food!  The chicken crepes were fantastic and I recommend the white sangria...  however, the service (or lack there of) was of the worst caliber I've encountered in Old Town Scottsdale. Polly, our server was very rude. We waited 15 min for water and another 25 for the bill.  She did fill our water ONE time, I'll give her that.  

Make reservations and plan on waiting!

After lunching at Arcadia Farms, we decided to take a walk, as we heard the Marketplace where they sell their baked goods was not too far. Little did we know, all we had to do was cross the street!

Arcadia Farms Marketplace has several pre-made sandwiches and salads to choose from if you want to pick up a quick lunch. The case is full of some scrumptious looking baked goods, which I will definitely need to save room for next time!

We didn't buy anything this time, since we had just eaten, but what a convenient little place to pick up a quick yummy meal...and even better, most items are a few $$ less than on the menu across the street!

I came here for lunch with my mother-in-law and sister-in-law as the start to a girls' day out. I have been all over the Scottsdale scene, so it's a wonder it took me so long to get around to trying this place out. Let me begin by saying that this cafe is ADORABLE. I can't imagine a cuter lunch place if I tried and I'd come here again and again just for the sweet atmosphere. The service was quick and we were well attended to. My only qualm is that the menu is somewhat limited. There is a giant list of salads with an additional small list of meals that all included goat cheese or brie, which I am not fond of. In the end, I chose a strawberry salad. It was fine, but I don't really like salads, so for all I know it was the greatest salad ever and I just do not have the right palate to judge salads. But lucky for Arcadia Farms, the experience is more important to me than the food itself, and I had a great time. I will most likely return, as I am just totally in love with this beautiful little gem.

What a great luncheon date, bridal/baby shower, girlfriends-catching-up setting. I adore the patio, with its plush cushioned seats and even more so, the inside is adorable. We had just arrived in Scottsdale after a 22 hour trip and wanted somewhere to sit and relax for a little bit. We came upon Arcadia Farms and took our luck without a reservation. Luckily the hostess helped us out and as we weaved through the somewhat tight seating, I knew this was my kind of place. She led us out on to a back patio and in to another little seating area where there were women talking over glasses of white wine and amazing look lunch dishes. 

       We sat and were brought water and offered Apricot Iced Tea--of course I chose to try it, it sounded fantastic (and I wasn't disappointed). After looking over the menu (and having a hard time deciding) I chose to try the Pesto Shrimp Salad, while my mother got the Turkey and Brie sandwich. Both were phenomenal, the pesto and the shrimp were both spot on to make a simple salad more flavorful and exciting. It was a perfect light meal after a long, long car ride.

My 4 star rating is with a big fat juicy caveat... Let me start with the 'bad' part. 

To their GLUTEN FREE customers... BE VERY, VERY careful. We dined there with my sister today for lunch. She has ciliac and has to be very careful not to eat any gluten. Since this restaurant was highly ranked as gluten free-friendly, we decided to go. 

The menu clearly labels which items are GF. BUT the menu wasn't accurate... We were told by our server that some of the dishes have changed, and the menu hasn't been updated to reflect these changes. You must be careful to ask the server all the right questions to ensure your dish is truly GF. For example, one of the dishes is GF. Our server recommended it, saying it was tasty. When we asked her in detail what it was like, she ended her description with 'and only very lightly breaded' before frying. When we inquired about the breading, she said, "it's not real bread... It's panko". We felt embarrassed to explain to her that panko bread crumbs are real bread. Duh.

So she ordered the salad, which had raspberries, goat cheese, and grilled chicken. Looked delicious, and the menu said it's GF. She even asked that the candied pecans be left out, since we didn't get a good feel from her that she knew if the chef used flour or not (because some do). The salad arrived, and the goat cheese had a slight ... coating ... on it that caused us to be concerned. The server assured us it's grilled goat cheese and that the coating we saw was from the grill. We asked her to please double check and it turns out they use rice crispies to coat the cheese. Rice crispies??? I know there is GF rice crispies, but we doubt they're using it. We sent the entire salad back to be re-made, in case gluten crumbs remain on the rest of the food.

Enough with the bad. Let's do the 'good' part.

The food at this restaurant is simply amazing. Full of flavor, fresh as if you cooked it yourself, I would not hesitate to eat here again, sans my GF relatives and friends. I had the tuna sandwich for lunch, along with the potato salad. It was fantastic. One of us got the crabcake, and being originally from Baltimore, we know good crabs. This crabcake rivals those we would get back home. I had no room for dessert, but I definitely will come back and order dessert next time I'm there.

There's a large outdoor patio (front and rear), so dining al fresco is pretty easy. During the heat of the summer it might be a bit uncomfortable, but the rest of the year it's fantastic.

Bottom line: if you aren't concerned about your food content (vegan, GF, or vegetarian) then I highly recommend this place. If you go because they offer GF or any specialty diet-friendly food, then I warn you to exercise caution: know exactly what you can/can't have, and ask the server. If the server seems unsure, ask to speak to the chef or someone else in the know.

Hidden gem off tourist mosh track nearly a not to miss if you're into French pastries and the like. It was just what I needed to start the day right and ensure all meetings go as planned!  Everyone who works here is also amazinginly nice and that's not something I usually notice but here it stands out!

We came here for breakfast on a Saturday.... service was extremely slow, as well as when we placed our order. Must of the tables were not cleaned...once we received our breakfast..it was okay. May have been just an off day.

what a wonderful thing our first option was crowded and my friend remembered this place. I It is a bit over my budget, but this was my birthday treat.

We tried 2 of the classic things they have. I had the fresh mushroom with goat cheese and keel and my friend had the chicken crepe. I found more taste and flavor on the first one, but in general both were really good. We finished with one of their deserts. The raspberry chocolate cake mmmmm or something like that. SHARE IT!! to eat one alone is too sinful.

The place has a nice decoration and makes you feel very comfortable. Great to surprise a girl or a boy :).
The food was amazing, the service was awful.  What a shame, I wish I could give it 5 stars.

Arcadia Farms is one of my favorite places for brunch.  Especially for getting together with the girls.  This is not to say it's a "man-free zone," but, it is super cute.  It has a cozy English country garden kind of atmosphere inside, and on the patio.  Not only is the motif absolutely beautiful, but the food is super yummy too.  My personal favorite, from the lunch menu, is the Raspberry Salad with Fossil Creek Goat Cheese.  It's delicious and refreshing.  All I would add is that in my opinion, one goat cheese medallion is more than enough.  Thus far though I really haven't gone wrong ordering anything off their menu, it's all been wonderful.  

I definitely recommend this as an ideal place to relax, chat, and enjoy some delicious food.

Yum! Yum! Yum!  Outstanding service, fabulous ambiance, delicious homemade sangria, and even more delicious food.  We had the crepes, a fabulous greek salad, and the warm ham sandwich.  Everything was extremely fresh and tasty.  Then, for dessert, we took our server's recommendation and go the mini coconut cake.  We were so glad we did; it was so delicious and almost melted in your mouth.  We will absolutely be back and can't wait to take advantage of the patio when the weather cools down a bit.

I have wanted to visit Arcadia Farms since I moved to Scottsdale. I saved it for today as it was a special occasion after dress shopping for my wedding. It seemed like the perfect place to celebrate getting my wedding dress with my friend! I was thrilled to find out they had tables available and that the restaurant wasn't busy because I heard it could be on the weekend. We were seated after a few minutes and brought waters. I was offered a yummy sounding peach iced tea and was excited to order the caramelised onion cheese dip and sandwich. Unfortunately 25 minutes later I still did not have my tea and had yet to be able to order. I tried to flag down multiple waitresses with no luck. I was very hungry after not eating before my dress fitting and had seen our waitress wait on multiple other tables in our section. When we made the decision to leave to go eat somewhere else, the waitress offered to take our order. However, it was too little too late. We ended up lunching nearby and had a great time celebrating my wedding dress. I really wanted to love this place and make it somewhere I could take my mother, mother in law and sister when they visit. I will have to find a cute new girly lunch spot.

Wonderful atmosphere. 

Everyone is dressed for a Sunday meal. Great for a family gathering. The pace is southern slow.  Perfect for relaxing brunch. 

Be prepared for a 2 hour sitting. 

The food is nice but not the reason to visit. The service is kind but paced.

A must if you need to shift gears to time gone by.

This venue works for me as it contains:

-Unique "cottage" type feel dining environment. During cooler months, you can dine al fresco under some shade trees/bushes, and then seperate dining "rooms" inside. Low ceilings w/antique-ey brick-a-brack/tchotchkes adourned on walls. Feel like I'm back eating in my Gramma Esther's kitchen. Ahhhhh :)

-Elborate menu choices at a nice number. I tend to get overwhelmed if menu offers too much. 

-Friendly service. Warm smiles were everywhere and frequent check-ins.

-Quality food. I tried Pesto Shrimp Salad and was satisfied; however, they could have upped the pesto on mine as it was a tad skimpy. Had a bite of the Mushroom Tart and it was DAMN good. Desserts looked tasty as well.

Areas of opportunity:

-Housekeeping. Big chunks of food found as I pulled my chair out to sit. That's just gross. It wld be very quick and easy to do a light sweeping as patrons left, IMO, being that they have wood floors.

-Follow through. Had to remind our Server 3x to split our bill 3 ways. Also, never did get my lemon wedges for my chemical-tasting water. Booo!

Love the atmosphere here and the menu. Have been here in the past and have always had a 5 star experience. However on this visit the service was substandard and the food was average. The service was extremely slow - almost like the kitchen staff didn't show up. Although the waitstaff was trying to keep us and the other customers happy, nothing can overcome a 1 1/2 hour wait for our food.
comfortable victorian garden oasis in the heart of Old Town, perfect for a Sunday brunch or a lady date with the girls

This is the perfect place to go for a leisurely brunch or lunch with friends.  I've heard some people say "that's where chicks go" ...well, I'd say cheers to that, I guess we have good taste :)  

This place offers some really great menu items for health conscious people, which I really appreciate.  Sometimes I don't want to go to breakfast because it's just too fattening, but this place makes delicious meals that don't force you to go to the gym right after.

Great coffees, teas, and breakfast cocktails are a great added offering, plus the baked goods are perfect for a little indulgence. (hey, if you save calories during the meal, you can afford to split a pastry!! ...yes, I'm a horrible dieter.)

Every dish I've tried here so far has been wonderful, I really don't think you can go wrong with your order.  Make sure to check this place out.

This place is like an outdoor garden at someone's great-aunt's home in the Hamptons. We were seated immediately at a wrought-iron table outside under some misters and handed menus. It was a good 10 minutes before our server came out to take our beverage order and the only reason I stayed that long was because my escort excused himself to take a phone call. However, when our server did come by, she was super-nice. My Bee Eff had two eggs with bacon and I ordered some Frenchie-sounding crepe dish with ham and gruyere cheese, "with a creamy bechamel sauce."
Another 10 minutes goes by before she drops off our iced tea and orange juice, which are served in those wine-looking water glasses with the stems, and they're both sucked down pretty fast. And then we've got two empty glasses on the table, and no one ever comes back to see if we need a refill. At this point I am periodically checking the time because hey, it's hot outside and we have nothing to drink, and our server is seemingly nowhere in sight! Several minutes pass before she drops off a carafe of iced tea and some waters. Another TWENTY minutes and our food comes out, his is missing toast and mine looks revolting. But I'm really into crepes and I'm pretty open-minded about food so I dive in. Another five minutes goes by before he gets his toast and is told that there is no tabasco sauce anywhere in the building, nor in the building across the street that servers have had to run to in order to get things that are obviously missing from the restaurant (it seems that the company owns both properties but you'd think they would keep all of their restaurant stuff in one convenient location...). 
My date's food was "eh, no big deal. Eggs and bacon... you really can't screw that up." 
My crepes were the best part of the dish. They were the perfect consistency, thin, no lumps, no weird fried edges. I liked the CREPES. However... I was under the impression that the filling was to be ham and gruyere and it was ham lunchmeat only, not what I was expecting. The crepes were swimming in a watery, milky sauce that needed salt or some other seasoning (not quite the creamy bechamel I was expecting) and the gruyere was sprinkled across the top. So visually, if you can picture this: White cat vomit. But I was starving at that point and I liked the crepes part so I ate it. 
And then I wanted to pay and leave. And we couldn't even do that because like the entire experience thus far: no server to be found. Don't get me wrong, I didn't dislike her. I mean, when she did come around, she was one of the nicest servers I've ever had. She was just inattentive to her tables on the front patio. Getting the check took another fifteen and then I was ready to pay and it took so much longer waiting for no one to come back that it got to the point where I had to get up, go inside and stand in the kitchen while someone else rang me up. 

Bottom line: Mediocre, overpriced food ($40 for two small breakfasts and no booze), shit service. Not going back.

I work by Old Town and I have been on the hunt for a new regular lunch joint ever since the owner at my favorite place told me he doesn't hire women because "they aren't hard workers" (yeah, wtf - so I never went back.) A few weeks went by of horrible Chipotle and the occasional desperate drive to far away places like LGO and Pane Bianco. Finally I heard about Arcadia Farms Marketplace, looked up the menu online, and drove over immediately. They have a good assortment of breakfast items, and for lunch there is soup, salad, and sandwiches. Salads are pre-made to go, sandwiches you have to wait for them to make.

Sandwiches. I've been here three times so far (just this week, oops), and have tried three different sandwiches. The first, and my favorite was the mozzarella, tomato, basil sandwich. It's served on focaccia and the ingredients are super fresh and flavorful. In my opinion they overdo it on the mozz, so I removed about half, no biggie. Yesterday I had the curry chicken salad sandwich. Served on a really hearty multi-grain bread that was tasty and satisfying. The chicken salad itself was just meh for me. Just way too many raisins. I removed at least 20 and still managed to eat more than that. Probably wouldn't order it again since I don't mind raisins but this was overkill.

Today I went for the Smoked turkey and brie. This was really good too.. Although the description said it has cranberry mayo, mine had some sort of gelatinous fruit spread instead. Whatever, it was good. The walnut bread it comes on is awesome. Yum.

I love that they have more than one vegetarian sandwich option on the menu! I will be trying the Roasted Artichoke and Ricotta sandwich next. I tried to order the Pressed Chicken sandwich without bacon today, but they informed me the bacon is already mixed in with the other ingredients. What a bummer for those of us who don't eat pork. 

Drinks. I like the iced tea. They said it was mango but I couldn't really tell. I'm not much of a tea connoisseur so who knows. Today I got an Arnold Palmer thinking it would be sweeter than the tea but it really wasn't much of a difference. Also the menu shows an AP costs $3 when a reg iced tea or lemonade are only $2.50. Doesn't make much sense if you're just using half of each. But anyway she charged me $2.50 so maybe they realize the menu is wrong.

Baked goods. Extremely tempting spread! Brownies, cookies, muffins, scones, cupcakes, dessert breads, savory breads, macaroons, mini cakes, and more. All but the mini cakes are priced $2.50-$3 and are ginormous, so perfect to share. I've tried the macaroon - which was the size of a damn tennis ball! - it's like a meal in itself. I also tried a bite of my coworker's magic bar or whatever you call that thing with the coconut, chocolate, nuts, etc. It was pure sin. 

Shop. They sell all kinds of kitchen items, and you could easily whip up a cute housewarming or other last minute gift. There are platters, cutting boards, ceramic items and more. Currently there is no seating inside, only on the patio, so that could prove to be an issue when we hit the hottest months. There are about 5 parking spots dedicated to the Marketplace on the east side, just ignore the valet only signs. 

Service. There have been only two employees working on all my visits. One in the kitchen and one at the counter. They are quick and friendly and knowledgeable about the ingredients when I've had questions. 

Overall I am really pleased and will be returning often. I will update my review when I have worked my way through some of the salads and soups!

First of all I've come here many times !! I enjoy the ambiance and goat cheese appetizers love their desserts !! What I don't love is the slooow service !!
Don't come starving because you will wait to get your food a very long time plus even getting a table takes a looong time even when there's tons of tables open ! It always feels like the place is short staffed . Again I will still return just wish it wasn't so slow .
One of our very favorite places in Scottsdale. Consistently clean, fresh, inviting. Love the coconut baby cake, the Brie with caramel apples, the crab tower and so much more!
Charming, comfortable atmosphere; accommodated dietary concerns with good food.
This place is incredible! Food is amazing and the grounds are beautiful. Definitely coming back!!

Quality ingredients. Phenomenal bread. I had a tuna sandwich. It was good - I am no chef, but I watch a lot of chopped so I think I am pretty qualified to make the claim that the tuna could have used some sort of pickled flavor like relish. The bread though. I can't get over it! Baked nice and evenly. Top notch. This is a place where socialites sit and eat for 2 hours, so bring your red hat. Jk- u should probably call ahead though to avoid the tourists.
Of all the places I've eaten in the valley this is the loveliest.  Perfect place perfect service and the food is wonderful!

Alex A. and I wanted to try one of the fancy restaurants in Scottsdale and I picked Arcadia Farms because it seemed like the perfect place for a quaint little Sunday lunch. The fact that it was raining didn't detract from the cuteness of this place. It's nestled away from the hustle and bustle of Scottsdale Rd. but still close enough to walk to the Artwalk and have an overall enjoyable afternoon. The restaurant is very cottage-like, with small separate rooms. The space felt a little bit tight at times, especially at the entrance. But it has that very homey sort of feel. 

First thing I noticed was that the crowd here was generally older. It seemed like a big gathering of knitting circles or book clubs. But the food was by no means out-dated. It wasn't trendy nor very traditional - just very normal. 

Our service wasn't amazing, but it was okay. Our food came very quickly, which was a nice surprise. I really enjoyed the garlic bread that they served at the beginning, and I'm not even a fan of garlic bread. Our first batch was cold, though.

We ordered the Arcadia Greek Salad and the California Club Sandwich with the split pea soup. It was nice and well-proportioned, but again, I didn't think it was blow-my-mind amazing. The hummus that came with the Greek Salad was pretty exceptional, and I gobbled that right up. But everything else was...meh.

I'd come for the dining atmosphere. Too bad it was raining today, but I imagine that outside garden/patio area would be very nice to dine in. I didn't care that much about the food, though. The prices were normal (about $12 to $16/plate), and the presentation was very appetizing, but nothing we ordered was very great. Maybe we didn't order the right things, but I don't think I'd be coming back to try other stuff very soon.

This is probably the worst restaurant I have been in Tempe area. The lemonade tastes awful... it smells like they never wash their glass. After i complained about the lemonade, they still charge me for the lemonade. I think it is ridiculous. The waitress forgets my starters. And she didn't come to our table to ask our orders. So I have to call someone else to order the dessert and then I miss the coconut baby cake( which is the reason why I want to try this restaurant at first). They have sold out the coconut cake when I order even the table next to me ordered 4 coconut cake only 5minutes earlier. And the chocolate baby cake don't taste good at all. Ice tea and wild mushroom crepe tastes good. But this doesn't provide me enough motivation to come again. Bad experience.

This place is so cute! They have many great and healthy breakfast/brunch and lunch options. We came for lunch and I got the turkey and brie sandwich with a side salad and it was excellent! The portions are a nice size and the desserts are very rich.
Wonderful atmosphere. 
It was hard to find parking during lunch time, but right across the street from Arcadia Farms is a valet service.

Met my mother here for a weekday lunch. We had to wait to be seated on the patio, but well worth it. The waitstaff is very professional, and the surroundings are so peaceful, making our meal very pleasant. Food was delicious. I ordered the chicken cobb salad. No rolls or bread were offered with it though. If I had a magic wand, I would create more parking. Having to valet park for a 1 hour meal on a Tuesday, or walk 2 blocks, seems unfair. If you are not in a hurry, and the weather is glorious, you won't be sorry!

Just came from lunch this afternoon after receiving horrible service. And they weren't even busy! My girlfriend and I met at 11 a.m. to avoid the big lunch crowd as we both work and needed to get in and out.  We were seated promptly and our server took our order, but it took over 25 minutes to get two salads!  Didn't see our server again for another 15 minutes.  My girlfriend didn't finish her salad and was going to take it home.  When our server finally showed up to the table next to us, I asked for our check as we were running late (by now it was 11:55) Apparently when I was looking down to get my credit card, someone took both plates without asking if we wanted a box to go.  It was clear the plate was 3/4 full of salad and any server would ask if we wanted it to go.   When I asked our server what happened to our plates she was clueless!  Even though the food is good, the service should equally be as good.  Not sure I will return.

Cute place. Nice ambiance. Great food, wonderful desserts. I had the crab cakes, the y were delightful, laid upon a bed of Greens. A lovely key lime tart desert! The market place next door has their salads and deserts as well. I went in for some take home deserts and found it was happy hour, half off! Score! 

Definitely would go again, great place for the ladies to gather and chat!!

Believe it or not, we showed up here about 0745 on a weekend morning and not a soul in sight. This was after bypassing the Daily Dose due to the crowd waiting for a table. For a second choice, I think we won. The breakfast here was A-1. Service was great. We sat outside ( I want to revisit this later), the decor is great, outside seating front and back. Now, the brunch is served acorss the street later in the day. We had the cafe breakfast. My co-pilot and I got some peach mimosas (not too many) and Egg Strada Cobbler (Cheddar over eggs with roasted vegetables, creme freche, and this very lean sausage). We also had the mushroom leek quiche, which was this awesome pastry shell with pungent veggies and spinach. Both very filling, The fresh fruit was awesome. So, no complaints on the food, service, anything. Why no 5 stars? You ask. WELLLLLL, that lush greenery on the patio comes along with it's share of lurking predators, known on the East Coast as the "skeeter". We were eaten whilst we ate and left there covered with mosquito bites. I am not talking a few. I am talking 10-20 bites each on our legs. And the Arcadia Farm mosquito is not a weak one, it is a flesh-swallowing mutant...so- spray with OFF! if you're going to sit outside. Don't say I didn't warn you,. THE FOOD, THOUGH IS WORTH IT!

Had a reservation for 3 for brunch and were told to stand outside in the heat while they seated people behind us without reservations.  There were many empty tables that would have accommodated us but they chose to seat others.  We were eventually walked through the patio to a back low-ceiling, paneled, enclosed shed-type building with no air circulation and zero charm.  On our way out, we saw the 4-top tables had been seated with customers.  I wonder why we couldn't have been seated in the main restaurant? Very unhappy with the experience.  The food didn't justify tolerating that kind of treatment.

Showed up with a reservation, and was told they're very busy,  and we could be added to the waitlist, despite our reservation. Told it would be at least 20 minutes. Totally unacceptable to have a restaurant so poorly run.

I had a fabulous lunch here. The food, service, drinks, and location are all top notch.  I think the warm vegetable and chicken salad is the best salad in town.  We were a little early for lunch and the waitress took good care of us with sparkling wine while the kitchen prepped for lunch instead of imposing the breakfast menu on us.  Additionally, the location is charming and convenient.

Went from brunch on Saturday.  Our server was really friendly. Food was local and fresh.  We got a great seat at the front.  Food came out pretty quickly

We tried the Crepe Croque-Monsieur, 2 farm egg whites and fresh fruit.  The Bechamel sauces on the croque-monsieur was particularly good.

Great location and I love that they're patio is shaded (hello, we DO live in Arizona - other restaurants follow their lead please ;)  the decor is eclectic and waitresses are very friendly and service is quick and efficient. 

I ordered the mushroom crepes and they were amazing- the food is portioned perfectly there's no over eating. 

Go and check this cafe/bistro out!

Lunch was salmon with some (cold) roasted potatoes and spinach that was sour--however, overall, it was decent.  
This is a cute place, sort of a "gals lunch" type place for me and my girlfriends and their moms, but nothing super special.
Parking is $3 plus tip, so figure on that.
Overall, ok...nothing fantastic--just okay.
