Service: Everyone was pleasant and helpful. Each seemed to have their specific role and no crossover was allowed. The main Waitress was doing a 5 Star job and it was only her second day on the job. She was doing everything. So I watched as I thought this was interesting. An owner, a second owner, and a daughter and a granddaughter were letting her do all the work! Then we ordered food and the granddaughter and cook sprang into action. The daughter delivered the food. The waitress went to get our drinks and of course the machine was out of coffee, so she had to remake it herself even though things were getting busy...interesting arrangement but it seemed to work for them. I hope the new waitress will be appreciated as she seemed to be handling everything on her own. I left her a good tip. The owners were not the ogres that I imagined them to be at first. All seemed good. I just thought it was interesting to observe the work arrangement.

We both liked it and my wife bought a few extra items that appealed to her for herself. Im going with 5 stars and really recommend this place.

Its okay... 
Foods good.. Had the strawberry salad 
Service is good... 
Just really don't care for the clientele. Snooty Scottsdale women who "lunch". 
Perhaps I wasn't in the mood, I don't know. Just did nothing for me. 
Wouldn't go back.

Fantastic little cafe! I had a great brunch here earlier today, on the patio with my girlfriends. The food is priced very affordable and it was delicious. The staff were very kind as well. I give this five stars for a wonderful experience all the way around.

Let me start by saying:
1. I NEVER write yelp reviews. Nor do I read them often
2. I am a brunch snob. I live in Chicago and we brunch often at some of the best restaurants 

With that being said- this is the BEST brunch I've ever had. The atmosphere is incredible, calming, and everything you hope for in brunch.

The food so awesome! I am a plain Jane who doesn't like new things but the quesadilla has changed my views on trying new food.

Highly recommend!!

Sunday Brunch at Arcadia Farms is so nice - relaxing - never feel rushed ~ although there is a constant stream of people coming in ~ 
Our waitress was so pleasant and made suggestions for lunch.  Awesome meal - my friend raved about her shrimp salad!  Albacore sandwich is always delish.       Love coming to this great establishment right in the heart of downtown Scottsdale.  Great food, great service*****

The rumors are true... its the ultimate ladies lunching kind of place. You can't go here on a weekend without seeing a baby shower, bridal shower or just a group of women gabbing and enjoying the uber-girly decor and garden setting. 

The best part? The food is just as good as the vibe. If you're looking to get in with your future mother-in-law - take her here.

My friend, my toddler and I enjoyed lunch here today on their beautiful patio. Our mouths watered the entire drive there as we talked about the menu (we had looked it up on-line) and discussed what we would order. We were immediately seated even though we didn't have a reservation on a Friday at noon and they have high chairs which I always appreciate (and I'm sure most of you, rightfully, could care less about). 

It didn't take us long before we decided on some white sangria, the crab and avocado tower, savory smoked salmon cheesecake and the wild mushroom, spinach and goat cheese tart. The waitress told us that if we wanted everything to come out at once it would be faster. OK. Doesn't make sense to us, but whatever you say. Meanwhile we enjoyed our sangria which was garnished with beautiful fresh fruit but tasted pretty heavy on the OJ. While I've never met a white sangria I didn't like, I have to say the Chelsea's Kitchen's white sangria is much better. Of course everything at Chelsea's Kitchen is so heavenly, God must be working in the kitchen and if that's the case, he mixes a mean drink (and my God mixes cocktails), but I digress. 

The three plates arrived together and we started on the goat cheese and mushroom tart first since it was warm. It was so delicious I wanted to hold it in my mouth a little longer than one might consider "normal" just so it's beautiful cheesey, silky, earthy, mushroomness wouldn't have to vacate my taste buds so soon. Leeks, mushrooms and goat cheese - now that's a menage a trois! Maybe I was a little clairvoyant when I saved the last few bites of it to eat at the end of the meal to have that flavor left in my mouth last. 

Next we had the crab and avocado tower. My toddler has a thing for seafood so he had the first bite and we probably should have paid more attention when he didn't finish what I gave him. It had such a beautiful presentation, not much thought was given to seasoning the crab mixture. Now don't get me wrong, the crab was incredibly fresh, it was just bland. It needed a splash of citrus to brighten it. It also came with a small bowl of bland gazpacho that we fixed with salt and pepper but we weren't sure what to do with it. The dish didn't come with a spoon so surely it wasn't meant to be eaten that way. Was the crab meant to be dipped into it? That didn't work well because you couldn't get the chunks of veggies (and I like my veggies). We gave up and dumped in onto the plate and swilled our crab into it. The acid in the tomatoes helped perk up the bland crab a little bit. 

We saved what we thought was the best for last. The smoked salmon cheesecake. It looked so beautiful on the plate. Almost like a little cake frosted in mascarpone and garnished with capers. We cut into in and spread it on the toasted french bread and shoved it into our salivating mouths (and the salivating, demanding toddler). We both stopped chewing and just stared at each other. It was so bland, If it wasn't pink inside and I didn't know it was a smoked salmon cheesecake, I probably never would have guessed. And the worst part yet, the inside was dry and crumbly. I don't know about you but when I think of cheesecake, creaminess is at the forefront. We picked at it then my toddler ate the rest of it straight up with his fingers. Not only does he have a taste for seafood but he has a gourmet cheese fetish. The stinkier and more expensive, he thinks the better. What do they say about champagne wishes and caviar dreams? 

We were going to have dessert but decided against it. We figured we would cut our losses and move on. I understand why it's so popular with the senior set if what they say is true about older people liking blander food. Maybe Sunday brunch is better, maybe we ordered the wrong things on the menu. If you're interested only in the ambiance though, this place is for you.
Amazing food, drinks and pastries.  Must try the Strawberry Chicken Salad!
Highly reccomend trying the Grilled Veggie & Chicken Quesadilla and the Black and White Mini Cake.  Very cute restaurant with a nice patio.
i love this spot!  so cute and amazing food. try the goat cheese appetizer and the herb chicken sandwich. you will not be disappointed!

Um wow. The service here is awful. I have really never been compelled to write a review but just want to say... be prepared to wait for drinks for at least 20 mins. I wasn't even asked even though I was sitting alone and many couples came in after me. Waitresses will walk away while people are still talking to them. Other than the horrible service, I can't speak on the food because I haven't been able to order. The place is very cute though. I ended up leaving after 35 minutes of no one addressing me right on the front. :(

I heard great things about this place and wanted to try it. I brought a girlfriend in for her birthday. It's a bit cramped but is still a nice atmosphere. We came at the end of brunch and were only able to get lunch which wasn't ideal. I'd like to give the place 5 stars but our server was pretty rude to us. I hope that if I make it back I will have a better experience.

The food was ok but service was horrible.  Went last Saturday for lunch (8 adults, 3 kids).  We were the last to arrive in our party so the rest have already ordered appetizers.  As soon as our server got our drink order, I ordered a cheese quesadilla for my toddler.  I also ordered a cheese plate for appetizer.  My friends' appetizer orders came so I asked if my cheese plate was coming.  Server said I thought you wanted it with your lunch entree.  Ok fine I guess I have to specify I want my appetizer served first?!?!! My main entree came but my cheese plate and my toddler's quesadilla still haven't arrived!  I asked to cancel the cheese plate and he said it is already ready, he just need to bring it out.  It was obviously not ready because it did not come until about 10-15mins later.  Finally, we've asked for our checks to be split and he said it would be too hard to do!  So basically a NO!  And because we had a big party, we were automatically charged 20% gratuity.  I will never recommend this place.  Food is ok, nothing great to rave about.  Service is awful!

I would have to give this place a 2.5 stars. First off service is extremely slow & that us defiantly this places major down fall .I went here with a girlfriend and her brand new baby and my 2 yr old daughter it took them 2.5 hrs to get us out of there ? Thank god our children were well behaved, it took about 10-15 min after ring seated for someone to come around and ask for our drink order. Then when we wanted to place order I wanted the turkey & Brie sandwich minus the Brie our waiter informed me that food is pre made  & I couldn't get that ? For $14.00 sandwhich I would expect a fresh one made at least so I changed my order to the chicken quesadilla it was very tasty :) we waited around for our check for about an hr or so we were just chit chatting so didn't realize it had been that long but to add insult to injury my girlfriend paid cash & for her meal & never had her change brought out the server we finally flagged down and said could you bring our change and she was like of you want change ? Uh yeah I want my change so that pissed my friend off big time we were getting up to leave & the server was hovering around to get her tip very annoying because whenever we needed to be served she was no where to be found ?  The restaurant itself very cute & charming & could have a ton of potential but I would rather go elsewhere for the price & service. Overall food was just ok nothing special. I did check out the little market across street to get daughter a cookie very friendly staff & cookie was delicious :)

Amazing atmosphere and food! They have a wonderful display and great home made pastries on display that are not only mouth watering to look at, but also enjoy. Janice runs the store and does a great job helping the customers and the staff. Truly a wonderful place for fun meal!

To be quite honest, I think one star is one star too many for mine and my family's experience today at Arcadia Farms Cafe. We arrived at 12:30 pm, and there was a line of people out to the door waiting to be seated which was expected from a restaurant, I guess. We were totally okay waiting 10 minutes to be seated. Once we were seated, with two out of the three menus that were needed, we chatted and noticed that no one had even bothered to ask for our order in 30 minutes--we weren't even saluted by a waitress or given water. It was a bit concerning so, one of us stood up and left to ask if we could get our order taken. After a few minutes, a waitress came to give us our well-deserved water and until what felt like an eternity, came up again with another waitress to get our order. My sister asked if the "FRESHLY-SQUEZZED orange juice" was any good. The waitress replied by telling all of us that the supposed freshly-squeezed orange was anything but. Adding to our theme of freshness--or lack thereof, she also told us that all of their sandwiches were pre-made! Meaning that they prepare them well in advance. "Why am I paying $14 for a reheated sandwich" is what I asked myself. Finally after another thirty minutes, I alone walked to Kaleidoscope Juicery to get some vegan pastries since Arcadia Farms is falling behind on that among other trends, like having an adequate amount of waiters/waitresses. After a 15 minute walk, we had not received our meals yet. So, we left: hungry, tired, and truly disappointed.
Great place to hang out if you are elderly and/or have nothing to do for a few hours....jeez!

Carolyn opened up her heart and restaurant to do a Memorial for a dear friend Kathie Foster a couple weeks ago. What can I say but 'Thank You!" It was just perfect in every way. The mood...the tables...the food...the details. Everyone raved and we knew at the end of the lovely lunch..... Kathie would have just loved it. If you have a special event...you should be having it here!

Lovely little place! It feels like the perfect place to take your Mom out to a nice lunch

I've had the Shrimp-something-something-Salad (it had avocado, goat cheese, tortilla strips?) It was great! 

annnnnddd I've had the chopped veggie salad- Also great! 

I kinda want to try all their salads now and pick my fav.

Whatever, we tried to to go to cafe Monarch across the street but they were closed for the holidays. We decided to go to poison pen across the street (which is awesome BTW) and they recommended Arcadia farms.

So head over, wait around for the hostess for a minute and take a seat in the back patio. The place is very...pretty? for the lack of a better word, definitely a good spot to take a lunchoen date to.

The bread was good that they gave us, little cheese crust on it. Had the apricot iced tea and it was quite alright. I asked for the cheese selection list and our server said they were out of one of the cheese's, so I made my selection and a couple of minutes later she came back and told us that they were out of 2 of the three cheese's that I had chose, so I just scraped the whole cheese idea and went with the California sandwich.

My friend had the ham and cheese and he said it was good, he ordered the soup of the day with his entree, which was butternut squash, it tasted like brown sugar candy liquid with little cubes of unseasoned butternut squash, couldn't finish it.

We ate our sandwiches and had half of them boxed up. our server asked us if we would like to see there dessert menu since that was what they were really known for. I said sure, she dropped them on the table, After looking at our dessert menus for 18 minutes our server shows up and asks us if we had made a decision, I said I had made several, But all I really wanted was the check.

So the food wasn't bad but it wasn't great, Maybe the desserts are great but i'll never know. In my opinion this place is an upscale applebees, just an extremely boring menu of sandwiches and salads, made with better ingredients.

I went to AFC with my dad and gram about a week ago. There were some big pros and cons: 


Pros:

Strawberry salad - the salad was very tasty, the strawberries were large, it had big pieces of chicken that were fairly juicy. I would order this again. 

The quesadilla - very tasty quesadilla with fresh veg, salsa, and guac. I liked how they browned the tortilla significantly and that it resulted in a nice crunch when you bite into it. 

Cons:

The roasted chicken sandwich... this was dry, bland, and just not good... and it sounded so good! Do not order. 

The service: Very slow, inattentive

The seating- when I entered the restaurant, the front room was fairly empty, yet they seated us in their back room. This room, though most likely intended for overflow seating, was packed with people (possibly the less fancy people, lest we infringe on the 'ladies who lunch'). This space was extremely loud, the materials it is made out of echo every sound, you can hardly hear yourself think. The door also needs to be pulled closed, and when it wasn't (which happened several times) it got extremely hot. 

The prices - this place is overpriced for the food you receive... it's a sandwich guys...much of the food isn't even cooked. 


Anyway, this would not be one of my go to places, but if invited here by family or friends, I would come back.
Nice fresh farm to table restaurant with delicious food.  Cute restaurant with outside patio with water mister system very necessary on the 106F day of our meal.  We will return.

I wanted to love this place. It's cute, great location, flowers and trees everywhere you look, fantastic patio, interesting menu. The reality is that parking is awful, birds whiz by your face and scamper across the awning constantly. Food was sub par, lacking in effort and overpriced. Cheese plate was lifeless, raspberry salad was uninspired and the turkey and brie sandwich we inquired about was "pre assembled" so we couldn't substitute for a different bread. The service was good and place seemed clean, think perhaps it's just not my cup of tea. I strive to find food made with love and lots of attention to detail. This seemed more pre made/churned out/ bland, etc. I know back in the 1990s this was the place to go, maybe a little reboot is necessary. Too many other options in South Scottsdale these days. Cute to look at from the outside. Enjoy your luncheons, ladies.

The place is so cute, has such a nice, sweet vibe. Both times that I've gone the service has been a little slow - probably because it gets really packed for brunch but still kind noticeably slow. The food is great. Small portions, for the most part, but good quality. Really cute spot to go on a date or bring friends from out of town. They also have a really cute bakery/shop next door that's worth a visit. The strawberry vanilla bean jam is actually the most amazing thing in the world. Enjoy!

Dear Arcadia Farms, When someone makes a reservation for 11 a.m. and says that want to order the breakfast menu, why does the person who takes the reservation say it's OK if it isn't? We arrived for our reservation, were given the lunch menu, asked for the breakfast menu, were told that they stop serving breakfast at 11, not given the option, as well as being informed that the kitchen is "really backed up". Did that mean that there was only one cook working? Because half the tables were empty. Our waitress couldn't have cared less when we told her that we were told we could order breakfast when we made our reservations. Truly, I could have laid on the floor choking on my own tongue and she probably would have stepped on me to get back to the kitchen. I give you 3 stars, not because of your so-so tart (and the only item available on both breakfast and lunch menus, lucky us!) but because of the carrot cake. My God that was good, so you've got that going for you. But really I could get edible carrot cake anywhere, and don't need to eat it at your restaurant.

Quaint, classy breakfast spot in old town Scottsdale.  Service was great, and the food was even better.  We had the black bean omelette and the fresh berry crepes and both were outstanding.  Go here if you are in the neighborhood!

I want to be a fan of this location.  The place was cute, enjoyed the decor and ambiance.  However, the services was extremely slow.  Our waitress was not at all attentive.  We had to ask another waitress for our complementary scones, water and even had to check on our food.  I ordered and omelet and it was not hot, not even warm.  Didn't bother to complain as I didn't want to sit there any longer then we already had.  We even had to take our check up to the hostess to pay, since our waitress was MIA.

This place is full of charm & quaint hospitality. I'd been to Arcadia Farms before but it had been a few years. I live an hour away so it's an event to go. They have a CHOCOLATE RASPBERRY BABY CAKE I couldn't stop thinking about. It's worth the drive. I needed a great place to celebrate a girlfriends birthday & I knew this was the place to satisfy our foodie palate. Our meal was delicious from the chicken & mushroom crepes to the chicken & strawberry salad. I'd talked up the chocolate raspberry baby cake to all the girls & couldn't wait to get to dessert. Then the unthinkable happened...... We were told they no longer have the chocolate raspberry cake....... WHAT????? The dessert I dream about, the dessert that brought us all the way from the east valley is no longer on the menu? We were nearly brought to tears! We ordered an apple crisp, baby coconut cake & baby tuxedo cake. All were delicious but for the love of all things chocolate & divine, PLEASE bring back the chocolate raspberry baby cake.

Disclaimer I only had scones, this is not a review of the food, but of the restaurant itself, which we didn't eat at because of such a negative experience we got up and left.

We arrived just before 11am on a Sunday, didn't have a reservation, and were told it would be a 30 minute wait.  There were several open tables.  We were visiting from out of town, not familiar with the restaurant and were not told breakfast stopped at 11.30.  We decided to wait seeing the open tables and many others leaving, as we had an event to be at by 12.30.

We were finally seated at 11.27, and given a mix of breakfast menus and lunch menus.  Upon ordering, we asked if we would be able to be done by 12.30 and were told it was unlikely, it is a small kitchen, it would take at least 45 minutes for our food.  We then tried to order breakfast and were told it was no longer being served.  We asked if they could serve it anyway, and were told no, the kitchen was closed for breakfast.  I informed our server we were given breakfast menus, she apologized and said there was a new hostess.  Another hostess came and informed us we could not have breakfast, if we wanted to eat breakfast we should have had a reservation or come earlier.  I told her we arrived early, to which she said it should have been earlier.

We asked if we could get eggs for my niece, who is 3 because she was so hungry.  They agreed to this, and brought it out quickly along with some complimentary scones.  The server refused to charge us, we informed her we were leaving as we couldn't wait that long for food and wanted breakfast.

If we hadn't wasted 45 minutes to be told we would not be served breakfast we would not have waited.  Arriving at 11am with at least five open tables should have allowed us to be served breakfast.  There was little apology or concern by staff, outside our server not charging us for the eggs.  

Having worked in the industry, I would never put up with staff who treated customers this way.  The hostesses were rude, condescending, non-apologetic, arrogant, and projected an attitude that they didn't care about the customers.

We also observed the party of four behind us have the same experience and get up and leave after waiting 30 minutes to be told they would not be served breakfast.  If we did not have an event to attend I would have asked to speak with the manager, I have never had such a negative experience.  I chose this place to eat based on positive reviews, I am sure the food is outstanding, but I will not risk the treatment to taste it.  I also understand it is a small kitchen, but 45 minutes for entrée's seems ridiculous.

Beautiful place, awesome food. Poorly run, had terrible service and had to ask for another server. I have a sugar allergy and therefor don't eat sugar or grains. The first server told us she didn't know if there was flour in their crepes. Shrugged her shoulders and didn't offer to ask. When I ordered the salmon I asked if it was farmed or wild and she looked at me like I had 2 heads. I asked her what was on it and she pointed at the menu and told me, exactly what it said on the menu. Once I got it there was a honey mustard sauce over it which IT DIDN'T say on the menu, turns out it was natural. I know because I am not on my way to the hospital right now. She's lucky. Our service after that was better. Except after I left the next server 30% tip, I asked her for a tea to go and she never came back with it. Poor attention to detail, my husband also got wrong directions to the restroom. Beautiful location, great valet and outdoor seating but I will take my $$ elsewhere in the future.

So, for work, our event today was at the Phoenix Art Museum and we all met for lunch before heading to No Festival Required.
Our table was ready - set for a group of 20.  Luckily, we only had a dozen people.  The table wouldn't have been able to comfortably equip 20, but was great for 12.  Just not enough space for the larger reservation we had made.
I had read the reviews first to see what kind of menu they had.
I opted for the brie and fruit appetizer, along with apricot iced tea.  I'm not HUGE on apricots, but I ended up having my glass refilled twice.  It wasn't too sweet and came with a slice of lemon.  I could have drank a gallon, if not for the fact that I'd be sitting in the theater to see the short films!   What a surprise to have it come - an ENTIRE wheel of brie with some baguette toasts, 2 strawberries and 5 grapes.  Yes, that's all that came with an ENTIRE wheel of brie.  I did ask for extra toasts and got that with no extra charge.  The entree cost $11.  I think that's pretty comparable to going to the market to buy an ENTIRE wheel of brie, fruit, etc.  More fruit would have been nice, though.  I now have a HALF of a wheel of brie in the fridge for later.  :}
Service was super-friendly.  Justin, our server, was great!  
I'd love to come here again with my Mom on a Sunday and check out the rest of the museum.

Service was incredibly slow. Not a good experience. After a while we had to ask who our server was because people whom sat down after us were already served and many workers that walked past us, didn't even look at us. We got placed in the back corner of the restaurant despite our reservation and plenty other open tables. Took 20 minutes just to get a salad. 1: I hate to complain, 2: I hate to waste, 3: I hate to cause problems but, BEWARE the raspberry goat cheese salad with added chicken. The chicken tasted like CRAB of all things. It was like eating a crab/fish salad. After having to flag down our server again I told her about my strange salad and all I got was an "oh I'm sorry" while she was still walking past us while I was trying to explain, and she left again. We later had to flag her down for a check as well. I suppose they thought giving us two free cookies made up for the $17-$18 salad that somehow tasted like fish. Used to love this place. Now I'm not sure if I'll be back.

SERVICE WAS HORRIBLE. A girlfriend of mine said she has been here before and the service was wonderful and the food was as well. So she decided to take me here for lunch for a great experience.  I gave them more than 3 chances to rectify the situation but they did nothing besides give me a Bellini on the house which I could have paid for my own, no problem. First, I ordered a warm brie with caramelized apple appetizer that they served me cold. The waiter indeed took the cold brie and served us a fresh one. But while we were waiting for the warm brie the food runner brought our entrees out and we informed her we still haven't had a chance to enjoy our appetizer and we simply weren't ready for out entree. The food runner had the nerve to ask us " well what do you want me to do with the food then", in a very ugly and agitated tone. Then she had the nerve to tell us she will set them aside until we are ready to have them. My friend then tells her well they will be cold by the time we finish our appetite and the food runner agains says well what am I suppose to do and you just ordered salad any way so it doesn't matter if I sit it aside or not. I actually ordered a grilled shrimp salad so I should have had hot fresh grilled shrimp. Which you would think it is her job to figure out what she is gonna do and not ask us how to fix the situation. So my friend very respectfully tells her that she will just have to make us fresh plates unfortunately because our appetizer was not served properly. The food runner rolls her eyes and literally stomps off with the food. I was livid at this point so when my waiter came back to the table I explained to him what had happened and he seems appalled about the situation and said he would talk to her because she should have automatically taken the food back when we told her we were still waiting on out appetizer and that it was common sense we would have fresh dishes prepared. So after the brie came out fresh and I honestly loved it. Actually an amazing appetizer when served properly.The same food runner comes back with our entree and when it comes out it had no dressing at all on it. So instead of trying to come off like I am trying to complain about it I ask her does this dish come with dressing or is it meant to be a dry salad. I asked only because it could be possible they serve it dry MAYBE. So she looks at my salad and clearly see there isn't a drop of dressing on it and sighs and says would you like me to bring you some dressing to put on it. By this time I felt like getting up and walking out but I relaxed and again explained to the waiter what happened with the same food runner he observed my salad and clearly said oh definitely there isn't dressing on it. I then apologize to the waiter because I don't like to be that complaining type customer and he said all the right things and took the salad to go put dressing on it which is what the food runner should have did instead of bringing me dressing to dress my own salad but I explained to the waiter I didn't even want the salad anymore and to forget it. He insisted he would make me something special to compensate for the horrible service I was receiving so I attempted to give him a third try to fix the problem.He then brings me the dish which I didn't get to enjoy because I was so upset from everything that happened I ended up no eating it. So when the bill comes I realized he didn't only charge me for the special dish he made to compensate for the horrible service but he charged me for the shrimp salad I never touched. I was in complete shock and I was so over the whole experience I just gave me friend the money to pay the bill and I walked out. I will definitely NEVER be going there again and if they know whats good for them they should fire that food runner because I'm sure with her attitude I'm not the first customer she has ran off.

Had a gift card, so we stopped in for breakfast while checking out Old Town. The breakfast quesadilla was a good change from the usual omelette offerings. However, the guacamole side was browning a bit. Coffee was just ok. My honey asked for hot sauce which never arrived, and the birds who can't stop begging for food make eating on the patio a little stressful. They will steal food off your plate, so keep an eye out!

This is one of my places I go every time I am in scottsdale. It's on the best places for a fun leisurely weekend brunch. The salads are off the hook and the mushroom goat cheese quiche was the best I ever had. 

The environment is very cute and makes you feel like you are having brunch in someone's back yard. And the desserts are fantastic, especially the coconut baby cake and the almond croissants!

Definitely try! You won't be disappointed

This cafe is just perfect! The food was amazing, I had a savory mushroom tart and my partner had a sweet crepe. Both just perfect. Our server Derek was very attentive and personal, we liked him a lot. I highly recommend visiting here and taking some pastries to go! (The scones are perfect)

My friend and I went here today for my 30th birthday brunch. I made reservations for 10:30 on the patio but wasn't aware that the back patio is closed until October which was kind of upsetting but the hostess let us pick a table on the front patio. After awhile it did get kind of hot and wish we would've ate inside but we still had a nice time.

Our waitress was nice and kept our drinks filled. My friend loved the peach ice tea and I had coffee and it was probably one of the best cup of joes I've had in awhile. I ordered the breakfast quesadilla and it was delicious! Fluffy eyes with sausage, zucchini, peppers, corn, cheese and served with fresh guacamole and salsa. My friend enjoyed her mushroom omelet with potatoes and a side a bacon. Very happy with our meals. 

Can't wait to come back in October when we can sit on the back patio!
Had a lovely breakfast... tried the crepe, fabulous. Excellent coffee, great atmosphere, lots of seating both in and outdoors.right by old town Scottsdale.

First time here and it will not be the last. Nice tasty somewhat healthy food. Interesting options that are healthier than most restaurants. Friendly attentive service food cook to order and nice selection to choose from. Is in an old house and has a unique feel and atmosphere. Definitely worth checking out if you're an old town.

Great we could bring the dogs. Had to sit in front on the street patio, not a big deal. Server brought water out for the dogs which was really nice. We went on a Saturday morning 9:30am. No reservations and got to sit down. After that, went down hill a bit. Our server was hard to track down, food was slow, table next to us said the same thing. We waited over 20 min to pay, they had to find our server. We had breakfast quesadilla and the egg strata. Both were so so. The salsa was really good. Egg Strata was very greasy and hard to eat.

Not that this place NEEDS another stellar review, but I'm going to give them one. While I've had my eyes set on this cute little patio for quite some time, I was finally able to enjoy the full experience with my mom last week. And it most certainly filled all of my expectations and then some.

The venue is impossibly cute. With an abundance of shade and draping ivy over the patio, outside is definitely the way to enjoy breakfast here. The inside was also quaint with plentiful seating options, so I'm sure as the season gets busy with good weather, an indoor table would hardly be disappointing. The menu has so many tempting options, the most difficult part of our meal was choosing what to eat. We both chose eggs for our "main" dish, but couldn't pass up the lemon bread pudding with blueberry sauce and creme fraiche. Holy. Mother. of Bread Pudding. I don't know the secret, but this is one of the best edible items my lips have every come across. We ended up taking our eggs to go after splitting the bread pudding because it was so filling AND it would have been a crime to leave one single crumb on the table. The egg dishes were a delightful lunch after our round of golf.

The service was awesome which made for a holistically pleasant breakfast. I can't wait to return for more bread pudding with a side of lunch next time.

We went to Arcadia farms for a birthday party. We had a party of 8 so we called the day before to get a reservation. We arrived a few minutes before for our reservation, and they sat a couple at the only table they could seat our large party at. So we had to wait for the two people they sat at a 10 seat table to finish before we could start. Just felt like a lack of forethought on their part. 

After we were seated we got our orders in then were promptly ignored. The food was actually light and nice. No complaints about any of the food it was all delicious. 

Honestly the food and atmosphere were wonderfully, if give this place a benefit that this was a hiccup of sort and try it again.

This place was really yummy!  My husband & I went for the first time last week, everything tasted so fresh, we got the mushroom/goat cheese omelet.  But the toast... I believe they make their own bread!!!   We will definitely be back :)

Fabulous lunch w/5 others. Two of us had the Chicken Oriental Salad - it was excellent! One had a sandwich which she said was marvelous. And the desserts!!! The 6 of us shared two: the Tuxedo which was like a Boston Creme w/the most gorgeous frosting! We also had the carrot cake which also was as gorgeous as it was yummy! But the best thing at Arcadia Farm: the venue itself! We sat in the front outside closest to the road but it was never an issue because the vines and other plants form a great block. It was a lunch to remember and I'll absolutely go back again!!!

I LOVE this restaurant I moved to California 6 months ago and still think about this restaurant often. 

Their service is wonderful, every server I've had here has gone above and beyond to give the best service. Once the server even went across the street to get a dessert for us because they were out in the main kitchen, she even put it together for us. Every experience I have had at this restaurant has been a positive one. 

The food is great also, their brie appetizer is so delicious as is their bruschetta. For entrees I seriously love their chicken and mushroom crepes, it sounds weird but trust me you have to try it. Honestly everything I have ordered their has been good.

When you go you must order the chocolate raspberry cake dessert oh my goodness I could go just for that.

As far as it being for girls only, i don't agree with that the food is made for both sexes and the servers are all female and all hot so what more could you ask for great food and hot servers...
Poor service and food is overpriced. The food should taste a lot better for what you pay. Also, it's really hard to get a table.

Great outdoor atmosphere with plenty of shade. Wait staff was very attentive, friendly, and gave great recommendations on their menu.

Our brunch consisted of the pulled pork hash, fruit crepes, and the breakfast panini.
All of the dishes were great. Waitress said she felt berry crepes were too sweet in her opinion. We felt they were perfect.

In any case, we loved our brunch experience here and would recommend it to anyone.

First off I tried to make a reservation on Yelp for Sunday at 10:30am. and recieved a notice that first available was 1pm. I decided to call on Sunday after they opened and was able to get a reservation for 10:30am. When we arrived we noticed the restaurant was very quiet with several empty tables. We were seated about 10 minutes and no one had come to our table to even bring water. My husband got up and wen to the hostess stand to ask for water. a few minutes later a waitress came by with water and left saying she'd be back. After about 15 total minutes of being there we were finally waited on. Our food was brought out without delay. We shared a iced pumpkin cookie which was delicious; soft and chewy. Their coffee is very good and it is organic. My husband enjoyed his omelet and my mother enjoyed her scrambled eggs. I ordered the wild mushroom tart and although it was tasty it was barely warm and I asked if it was something that is usually eaten cooled. I was told that it is not and although prepped in advance it is cooked when ordered. It seemed as if mine was cooked about an hour earlier even what was supposed to be melted cheese in top was hard. Our waitress was very nice about it and management took it off our bill.  This was our second time here, we really enjoyed our first visit which was Mother's Day but this visit was just disappointing.

$7.04 - that's all we spent here. Two regular coffees and a giant cookie ($3 cookie - whoa). It was an early December Sunday - rainy, cloudy and cool. We had wandered the Phx Art Museum and now wanted to relax with a cup of hot java. Upon entry, we weren't sure if they were even open. They were for drinks only, considering the museum was to close in the next 45 minutes. We meandered toward the bar and waited for someone to spot us. Soon, we had two steaming hot cups of coffee. Getting fresh cream required a request. Fair enough, I guess. 

We sat outside, somehow managed to find the most dry seats we could. The table still collected rain drops from a previous fall. It was a beautiful garden, especially considering the overcast skies. A family of three wandered by, the little daughter stopping to examine the lights along her pathway. She was a mini explorer, and she was adorable. 

Arcadia Farms Cafe, inside the Phx Art Museum (in case you didn't pick up on that), says it's "the cafe of choice." I'm sure that's true, if you're at the museum, for it's the only cafe of choice. It's not a horrible option, either, if you want to pop in for a cup of coffee, a cookie treat and meandering conversation.

Went for Sunday brunch at 11 am and had a very enjoyable meal. The attitude of the hostesses wasn't as inviting as I would have preferred, but everyone has their off days. They have indoor seating and outdoor, and though it was a perfect day for outdoor, we chose to sit in because there was more comfortable seating.

There were only two things keeping this from being a five-star dining experience. One was the appetizer we chose. Our initial decision came down to two choices: a 'crab and avocado tower' and 'salmon cheesecake.' We went with the tower, which didn't end up looking like a tower at all. It was certainly interesting, but it looked like a Chef Boyardee can had been filled with crab and avocado, then overturned. Once we dug in, it was a solid cylinder of 'meh.'

After a very underwhelming appetizer taste-wise (I knew we should've gotten the salmon cheesecake...) we ordered our dinner. I decided upon the chicken quesadilla. My mates balked at my decision to order a quesadilla when there were so many other options on the menu, but my reasoning was thus: if they are so fancy shmancy, then they'll take something simple like a quesadilla and knock it out of the park.

I was right on the money. I was able to taste the wild mushroom, chicken, and leeks crepe that neighbored my quesadilla, but it didn't compare. The quesadilla and accompanying guacamole was about as good as one could expect to get from a place that doesn't specialize in Mexican food.

If I weren't the type who tries to enjoy all the items on a restaurant's menu, I would definitely order the same thing on a return trip. I had a mimosa and a sangria to wash it down and both were delicious. It ended up being a delicious brunch to kick off what would be an excellent Sunday.

The other thing I didn't really like was our server. She was nice enough, but whenever I declined a suggestion she had made (cookies for desert, for instance) she said, "okay, just checking on ya." She said this multiple times to the point that it became a running gag at our table. It's not really an issue, but it is pestering. This is not my first trip to the rodeo. I know how restaurants work and I understand what a waiter or waitresses' job is, thankyouverymuch.

I will probably return sometime soon. It was very good. Next time I'll sit outside (if it isn't too hot out) and try that salmon cheesecake. Just writing about it is making my mouth water.

I'm torn between a 4 star and 5 star for this place. The food, drinks and atmosphere were all amazing. It's the perfect breakfast, brunch, lunch spot and great when it's a nice day outside to sit on the patio.

We had a couple items from the bakery, a salad, chicken sandwich, and a scoop of the tuna salad....all were great! The service was definitely slow which is the only thing preventing me from giving them 5 stars. It may just be the kind of place that has a more relaxed atmosphere and nothing is a rush. I didn't expect that so I was a bit impatient. Maybe I'll move it up to a 5 star next time knowing that it's a more mellow atmosphere & I should take my time enjoying the amazing food.

The food is always good and love the atmosphere.  The only reason i don't give it a 5star is the servers and workers can be snobby. The server we had this time was great and one of the best we have had but in watching and listening to other servers, management still hasn't addressed this with their workers.  We keep coming back because the food is excellent however, we definitely don't go as often as we used to and I did notice they were quite empty for a Sunday.  They just need to tell their employees to be nice and they would get 5stars.
Been around forever & not even in arcadia, but I gladly drive by lgoNo! Easy to get to & plenty of street pkg. carry on Carolyn...

Arcadia Farms Cafe is a pretty little restaurant in a great location but a few things prevent me from giving it three or four stars.

Firstly, the fact that it's a breakfast/lunch place that stops serving all breakfast / brunch items at 12pm on weekends (11am during the week) is pretty much a cardinal sin in my book. This is the only restaurant I know of, that's open until 3pm that does this. 

Butters, Eggstasy, Scramble, Butterfields, Daily Dose, Morning Squeeze, etc. all have a similar niche, similar hours and serve all breakfast/brunch food items on the menu until they close at 2:30 or 3pm. I was really, really disappointed to come to Arcadia Farms Cafe at 1pm on a Sunday for brunch only to be told they quit serving it an hour earlier. 

And sadly, they seem to have far more breakfast/brunch items on the menu than they do lunch items, which is confounding. Why have all of your most alluring menu items available for a 3-4 hour time span? Especially on the weekends!

Secondly, I wasn't thrilled with my entrée- which was the vegetable quesadilla. The cheese was sort of gloppy and the vegetables were cut too large to actually stay in the quesadilla. With every bite of the quesadilla, random vegetables kept tumbling out. I wasn't impressed.

My friend and I did split the goat cheese dip and it was actually very, very good. I usually despise goat cheese, but I think they may have mixed it with something else to create this dip, because it was creamy and not as funky tasting as I generally find goat cheese to be.

I also very much enjoyed the white sangria.

If I were to give Arcadia Farms another chance it would be during their (painfully limited) breakfast/brunch window. The lunch menu wasn't impressive or varied enough for me to return for that meal again.

Was able to get seated outside at a roomy table for Father's Day brunch. The scone/pastry provided was moist and delicious. Had the strata and was happy to see large chunks of sausage and vegetables that complimented the dish, and egg was not over cooked! Thank you! Bacon was cooked perfectly. Also samples the savory crepes, very flavorful. Great breakfast.

We visited Arcadia Farms on a recent trip to Scottsdale and it was one of our favorite meals.  We went for breakfast and sat outside on the lovely patio.  Service was friendly and fast and the food, fresh and delicious.  I can't even discuss the strawberry mini scones that were complimentary and served right when we sat down.  I literally still think about them when I'm at sitting at my desk at work.  Wish we had discovered it earlier in our trip!

Here we go, a five star review.  So, it must stand out to me.  Not that my reviews are the end all be all, but I do like to give props to places that really are top to bottom great restaurants.

Arcadia is one of these.  I can walk here when I'm down to visit my family, so that's a plus.  Fantastic breakfast, brunch, and lunch here, some of the best I've had.  They have a fantastic patio, very private, and even intimate.  Good wine list, lots of menu options, and awesome service.  

Just recently we were there and there was some construction next door.  They were cutting concrete, so you can imagine the noise on the patio.  The manager went over, got the construction foreman and gave him a piece of her mind.  Talk about sticking up for your patio customers.  They halted and we were able to enjoy our brunch.

I'll always recommend this spot to anybody living or traveling to Scottsdale.  Wine lunch?  Yes please.

Stopped here for lunch with my BFF today.

Nowhere to park, forced to valet, meh...

Love the atmosphere here: classy decor, beautiful patio. Everything on the menu looked delicious. I had a hard time choosing between many foods that I love: crab cakes, goat cheese, crepes... I wanted something lighter so I ordered the oriental chicken salad. In the meantime, our drinks were brought to the table. BFF pulled the spoon out of her iced tea to find that there was some leftover peanut butter still on it. The question is: who left it there? Don't know. Gross. This was pointed out to a server (not ours because she had not returned to our table). Our server brought out a new iced tea. She was polite, but not necessarily apologetic. 

When our meal was delivered to the table, BFF pointed out that there were tomatoes on her sandwich (she asked for no tomatoes). The server said that the other server probably grabbed the wrong plate. She came back from the kitchen twice to tell us that the new sandwich would be right out. So, I sat with my salad and waited to eat until BFF got her meal (It took a good 5-10 minutes for her new sandwich to come out). 

BFF raved about the dressing on her side salad. My salad was fine, but nothing to rave about (especially not for $13). The ingredients were fresh but the "shredded chicken" that was described on the menu appeared to be sliced chicken breast. To be honest, I prefer shredded chicken which is why I had decided on that particular salad. DISAPPOINTING.

The server arrived at the table to ask if we wanted to order dessert. We replied, "no, thank you". And she said something like, "oh, come on, are you sure?". Again, we declined but I really think she should have offered us free dessert after our bummer lunch.

The topper? 1 valet guy and 6 people in line to pick up their cars=a 10 minute wait just to leave the place. 

I would hesitate to come back, but that menu is just so damn tempting.

Before the death heat of Arizona set in a few friends of mine and I went here to celebrate a birthday.  We sat outside which was covered, decorated with plants, and gave us a perfect view of the pastry window.  The drink specials all sounded great, but since I didn't want to look like a boozer I decided to only order one.  I chose a champagne and berry drink which was tasty and unassumingly strong.  Since we had a movie to catch we decided to skip the apps and got straight to business.  One of the ladies got the chicken and veggie quesadilla which was HUGE.  The other two got salads which they beamed about and I got the savory crepes that had roasted chicken, creamed leeks, and mushrooms.  The crepes were is a small bath of basil cream sauce that really brought the dish together.  I'm glad that we had a movie to catch, because I might have licked my plate down otherwise.

I just strolled in to see if I could find something for my semi sweet tooth (sweet and savory is more my style) and what a perfect place to get your fix . They have premade salads that looked like they had been made a few minutes prior , sandwiches, other items . The pastry bar was impressive , the cupcakes looked beautiful and everything looked so inviting .  I ordered a fresh squeezed lemonade and a lemon poppy seed Madeline , both were perfect for my fix. I will be back for lunch. 

Stay tuned...

If you're fed up with men, come here. There are none in sight!

Me and 2 of my friends went to arcadia farms for a caddy 'girls' lunch. I figured this would be the best place to take them after reading these reviews. Welp, I was right!

I made reservations online through open table which made getting a seat not a problem. Very cute inside. Made me feel like I was having a tea party. I felt like I should have worn my sundress :)

The food was delicious. We all agreed. The only sad part about it was I didn't realize my salad would come already dressed for me. My friend got the avacado tower thingy, and the other one got the chinese chicken salad (looked amazing), and I got the vegetable chicken salad. I asked for a to-go box WHEN I ordered it, so I figured I didn't need to ask for the dressing on the side. Wrong. That's where a star comes off. Another downfall was shotty service. You ask for bread, and get it 20 minutes later. They're pretty slow at filling up drinks too. But we were so busy talking and ended up occupying the table for 4 hours, so I'll continue being a fan of them just for not kicking us out :)

We'll be back again when we want to run away from the boys.

Beautiful atmosphere!
Great food!
The spinach omelette was great!
The mushroom tart was unbelievable!!
Wonderful service too
Highly recommended!
Beautiful place, and great staff, but somehow I just didn't love anything I ordered!

Horrible service.  Waitress tried to take our order before even asking if we wanted a coffee.  She couldn't answer basic questions about the dishes in the menu.  Didn't check up on us after the food came out or top up our coffee.  Food was average but didn't compensate for the brusque middle aged waitress.

Based on prior visits, I scheduled a little lunch here for some friends. We had a reservation and were seated promptly at 11:30am. Before I go further, it was NOT crowded at all. At 11:50 we finally received water and our drink order was given (but never received.) At 11:55 we asked to see a menu for lunch which started at noon. We were told we could either have breakfast or lunch but no combination - that's acceptable, but we wish we'd known that when we were seated. At 12:00 noon our server finally appeared to take our orders and we chose breakfast. I realize everyone has a bad day, but our server was not friendly, helpful, interested in us, or timely. Our food was delivered about 12:15pm. The french toast and the crepes were both quite good (hence the 2-star review) but the breakfast potatoes seemed straight from the can with a red coating and the bread pudding was soggy. No mention of baby cakes or dessert or coffee/tea or the original drink order placed. Service was so sluggish and unfriendly my guests could not believe I had suggested this place. Of course a poor review will not harm your stellar reputation, but I do hope that you'll pay closer attention to the smaller tables visiting your establishment on a Saturday morning.

It's the perfect place for brunch. Verey peaceful and beautiful, inside and outside. I always prefer outside tables though it's getting really hot nowadays. Food is good, not great, to my standard, but the atmosphere beats the taste. 

And all the pastries at the market look super duper good too!
Highly recommend for family brunch or casual dating with your love on Sunday morning!

It is hard to describe this place without using the word 'adorable'. But after eating here I came up with some more- delicious, fresh, and scrumptious.  Service was good even after we moved from an outdoor table to an indoor one due to the heat. This is a beautiful spot and the outdoor areas are lovely. We started with the Brie apple appy- it was exquisite. Two of us ordered the nummy mushroom, spinach and goat cheese tart for a main course. There is a generous side of salad included with this one which I could not finish. Delish! We went to the marketplace after lunch to "look" and left with some goodies for later in the day.  They even sell kitchen goods. Everyone goes here more than once!

This place a joke.  It's pretty clear that they hired some fancy check to create their menu and then he has never touched the place since.  
We came here because I saw the WARM goat cheese salad on the menu.  I'll get to that in a minute. 

To start, my husband's water glass had gobbs of lipstick all over it.  Our server was actually quite friendly and she is the only thing about this place that deserves any stars.  I ordered the warm goat cheese raspberry salad, my friend ordered the caesar with dressing on the side, and my husband got the quesadilla.  

The food came out surprisingly fast but it turns out that was because they forgot to cook it.  The WARM goat cheese was breaded but ice cold.  It had never even glanced at a heat source.  And my salad was completely missing chicken.  My friend's salad was slathered in dressing.  Fortunately my husband's food was at least decent although he wasn't raving about it.  We had to hunt down a random server because we couldn't find ours (she wasn't the person that brought our food) and it also took forever to get my drink refilled.  She sent our food back and yet again it came back with cold goat cheese.  The chicken was also cold and tough.  I had just completely given up at this point and just ate it, except the chicken which was tough and nasty.  

We also noticed that the table next to us received bread which looked quite wonderful but we didn't get any and would have loved to have some.  I even made a comment about them not having bread. 

We were completely disappointed and will never be back.

My friend and I who do lunch dates are starting to try new places that neither has been to.  This was the first stop on our adventure.  
When we arrived at this quaint and inviting establishment we were greeted with a smile and asked where we might like to sit.  The outdoor seating looked nice but since it was the middle of summer we went to one of the indoor areas.  We got the iced tea and the cheese plate to start.  It was a small cheese plate but it was perfect for 2 people to share.  The breads and cheeses were a great combination with the dried fruits and nuts.  I know that jams and honey are sometimes a part of the cheese plate picture but this was a small light taster to start.  The way we lunch is we both order an entree and then split it.  Today We order the Signature Strawberry Chicken Salad and the California Club, minus the avocado stupid allergies.  We informed the waitress that we would be splitting them so when they came out they were already split for us.  The first bite of the salad with that poppyseed dressing was so amazing that we both almost forgot about the rest of the food on our plates.  My salad was close to the potato salad so I accidentally got a taste and remember the rest of the food.  The potato salad is hardy and rich without being to mustardy.  It has bacon but it is not too overpowering and somehow still feels a little lite.  They had forgotten to take the avocado off so they immediately took it back and remade the sandwich.  I loved that you could tell that it was a new sandwich since some places take it back and try to scrape the avocado off when they forget.  They never get it all and so the benadryl comes out but I had no reaction.  The bread was this warm focaccia bread that I could have eaten all day.  The turkey was fresh, not slimy, with crisp bacon.  The meal ended up being too much for one sitting so we both had lunch for the next day.  We ended with the Red Velvet cake which came out looking so cute and tasting divine.  We have already talked about going back and refer people here quite frequently.  It is a little pricey but so worth it.

Great place for brunch/lunch. We had the omelette and the burrito. Service accommodated our timeline - on our way to the airport with only 20 mins for lunch. Wish we could have stayed! Pastries look delicious. Will return.

I came here for Sunday brunch with my mom, sister, niece and SIL.  Girls day out.  We were seated outside in the front patio.  The ambiance is great.  So cozy.  

- Crab & Avocado Tower $13.00 - delicious.  Crab was tasty and meshed well with the avocado and salsa.
- Warm Brie with Caramelized Apples $13.00 - How can warm brie and caramelized apples ever be anything but good?
- Strawberry Chicken Salad $14.00 - Was a bit too tart for us. We didn't finish this dish although we've been told it's their most popular salad.
- Chicken, Wild Mushroom and Leek Crepes $15.00 - this was pretty tasty and we gobbled it up.  There was still sauce leftover and we were offered bread to sop up the sauce, but we were too full.
- Wild Mushroom, Spinach and Goat Cheese Tart $14.00 - pretty good but after several bites, it does start to get a little heavy from the goat cheese.
- Warm Grilled Rosemary Ham Sandwich $13.00 - this was probably my most favorite out of everything we shared.  The bread was fresh and crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside.  The whole mustard aioli completed the sandwich.  

This place is definitely cute and a perfect place to go with your girlfriends.  It would also be a great place to host a bridal or baby shower.  They also have private rooms across the street and if I remember correctly, a bakery across the street, too.  

Staff overall was friendly, but the hostess who sat us, Polly stood out the most as she was friendly, cheery and informative.

My favorite place for breakfast, brunch and lunch! The servers are outstanding and really have patience with each guest. They always offer great recommendations if you're stuck between two choices! 
I am absolutely in love with their baby cakes. I personally get the mini coconut baby cake and it is the most delicious cake I've ever had. It's just the right size for 2 if you just want a little something sweet to share, or great to take a few bites and save the rest for later! It's covered in coconut and topped with a sweet strawberry! It's delightful! I take all of my friends here to have great food and wonderful conversation in an lovely atmosphere.

Old classic in old town ..... really enjoyed it !! Old school dishes and great service!!! Only huge upset was that there was no change table ..... which isnt a problem till its a problem and then its a big problem ;) 
Hope they invest the $20 to get this fixed and become more family friendly ..... but still a big thumbs up to Arcadia Farms

The spot for ladies who lunch...  need I say more?  Upscale lunch.  Very nice soups, salads, and lunch entrees.  Lovely patio.  Loud and bustling, full of botoxed ladies in tennis attire. You might feel out of place if you don't have a LV handbag, or even worse, you have no idea what I am talking about.  Make reservations.  This place is booked every day.

When looking for a cute patio, nice staff and good food, this is the place.  No soups thought...this place has soup spelled all over the front door, but they don't have any.
Oh well, I still enjoyed it.

If you know me, you know that I am a huge fan of Arcadia Farms Marketplace!!  Right when you walk in, your eyes get taken over by the amazing pastry, muffin, and cinnamon roll display that they make fresh and in house.  The restaurant has an elegant french country themed thing goin on but doesn't have the high prices to match (which is a great thing).   
Service seems to always be warm and friendly, the decor of the place is magnificent, and the food is quality.  

I dare you to try......anything. You will be impressed, and this place is still mellow enough to feel like your own little hidden find!

SO CHARMING! and food is SO DELICIOUS!! Truly farm fresh, I wouldn't be surprised to learn if all of their ingredients came from the farmers market next door. This is a perfect place for a nice dinner party, girls brunch, babyshower, you name it....so cute! 

The shrimp pesto salad is insane!!! And my husband swooned over the crab cakes.... They have an easy read menu...if anyone has a gluten allergy, you should have no problem finding dishes you can eat right on the main menu. 

Service was very friendly..... we were served water in cracked glasses, for some reason the waiter didn't notice at first (nor did we) but we didn't even have to point them out as he gasped when he saw them the next time he returned to wait on us  (and imediatly switched them out) 

I look forward to coming back again and again. :)
